results.description: You have work to do and can get it done remotely, working from home is distracting, cafes are sterile and uncomfortable, it's time to find a new environment. Let Club 157 be your office away from home office away from home. Come on over, plug in, use the wifi, there's a landline and printer onsite if you need. Feel free to bring something to share. There's usually coffee and cookies. We have a fridge and microwave and full kitchen because it is a home afterall. There is one cat onsite named Poem so I hope you're not allergic. Did I mention it's free to come over and cowork?
results.name: Club 157 Coworking

results.description:
We are so happy to announce that on Friday, December 18 from 11:00am-12:00pm The New Hyde Park Fire Department Rescue will be coming to Thinkertots  of New Hyde Park!


  They are coming to talk to the children about the importance of safety.They will show the children their gear and will also have the opportunity to go outside and go on their actual emergency Ambulance. Every child will get a memorial goodie so that they can remember this wonderful event.

Every child must attend with an Adult through out the whole event with the NHP Fire Department. This is a  FREE event.

Make sure to bring your camera to capture this event.
results.name: New Hyde Park Fire Department Rescue at Thinkertots

results.description:
We will meet in the field of dreams parking lot and walk to location. The area can be reached by the 44 bus, get off at Costco walk back to Richmond Ave. walk down Richmond ave to the field of dreams park sign, nwalk up the dirt road to the parking lot. We will walk to location from there.
What you will find, the main road is paved, woods trails are not. The trail goes from the mall to Richmond town. There are rocks, trees, closed up iron mines, bld foundations, streams, views of the surrounding area, fragmities in the marsh area. You may encounter wild life.
Wear good walking shoes and bring a walking stick for going off the main trail.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting in the field of dreams parking lot , it is off Richmond Ave. at the back of Costco.
results.name: Landscape shoot in the hills at the back of the mall

We will meet in the field of dreams parking lot which is off of Richmond Ave. you can reach this location on the 44 bus get off by Costco walk back to Richmond Ave. to the field of dreams sign go up the dirt path to the parking lot. We will walk to location from there.
What you will find marked trails, streams, trees, views of the surrounding area, closed up iron mines, building foundations, rocks. The main trails are paved, the trails into the woods are not. Wear good walking shoes, you may need a walking stick. The trail goes from the mall to Richmond town. You may encounter wild life, there are many areas off the trail which are interesting. results.description:
Want to check out Fullstack Academy during the day and learn more about our school? 

Come drop by our campus on your lunch break for a tour and short Q&A session! 

This is a great way to get a feel for the environment at Fullstack and get some of your questions answered about the school. Campus tours will be held on the 3rd Friday of every month.

Please register to attend here on Meetup and arrive by 1:15 PM. A team member will show you around campus, and afterwards there will be time for a short and informal Q&A. 

We look forward to meeting you!

-The Fullstack Team
results.name: Fullstack Academy Campus Tour

results.description:
Spring Lake Farms is offering a 15 pounds(in one pound packages)of 100% grass fed ground beef box for $100. Our beef is 100% grass-fed and dry aged. Our animals spend their lives on pasture and do not receive any drugs. So they are added hormone and antibiotic free! 

Our ground meats are extremely high quality, and has an old fashioned beef flavor because it is dry aged before it is ground. It is flash frozen at the butcher. 

You can pick this package up at anytime at our home in Valley Stream. If you have interest in a beef share, or a pork share please message me. I can reserve one for you. Otherwise, I will update what I have on this site with what I have in my freezer. Thank you for supporting my family's farm. 

Best, Ulla
results.name: All Ground Grassfed Beef Box

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for anyone wearing a orange or blue Pinnies.

results.description:
We are going to Killington Ski Resort - the biggest & best ski resort in NorthEast. Located in central Vermont, Killington has 141 trails and 21 lifts, extending across six interconnected mountain peaks. The main peak, Killington Peak (4,241 ft (1,293 m)), is the second highest in Vermont and has the second greatest vertical drop in the east (3,050 ft (930 m)) after Whiteface Mountain in Wilmington, New York (at 3,430 ft (1,050 m)). The mountains that make up the Killington resort separate the town of Killington (with its access road) from the city of Rutland, Vermont.

For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a full size bus so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating. All rooms feature micro-wave refrigerators, 32" Flat Screen TVs, Coffee/Tea maker, Hair Dryer, Iron/Ironing Board, Radio Alarm Clock.

New This 2015/2016 Season:  
* Room Renovations are 100% Complete!  
* All Guest Rooms- new EVERYTHING!! 
* New Lobby -Completed- New Guest Computer Room

*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***

Depart Date: December 18th Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier. 

Depart 4:00 PM from Queens: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 5:00 PM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Killington at 3:30 PM on Sunday Dec 20th and expect to arrive at NYC at 9:30 PM & Flushing at 10:00 PM.

Hot Breakfast (Included) - Eggs, Sausage, Toasting Breads, Belgium Waffles w/syrup, Bagels/Cream Cheese, Hot and Cold Breakfast Cereals, Yogurt, Bananas, Apples, Oranges, Breakfast Pastries, Juices, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Milk

Trip Includes: 2 days 2 nights ski/snowboard trip; 2 nights accommodation at Comfort Inn Rutland. 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Killington. Luxury bus/van round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls & parking. 2 daily hot breakfasts.

Cost:
Early Birds - Double Occupancy (Includes Transport) $279 for first 28 spots or by 11/20 Fri
Regular - Double Occupancy (Includes Transport) $299 afterward

Buy Ticket Here: http://dec2015killington.eventbrite.com/You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until you have prepaid the ticket.

Note: Double Occupancy = 2 persons in a two Queen beds or one Queen bed room.

Additional Cost: 2 day equipment rental (skis or snowboard) is at group rate $70 (regular $120). $15 for 2 day helmet rental. $100 to upgrade 2 day lift tickets to 2 days Learn to Ski or Ride (lower mountain lift tickets, ski or snowboard rental & beginner group lesson)

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 21 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 10 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $20 processing fee.

Video: 2012 Killington Thanksgiving Ski Snowboard Trip Group Run

http://youtu.be/xkMGHrLEX-U

2014: http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/25811834/

results.description:
Hello friends,
Please join us in our Xmas 'Qigong Marathon Challenge' where we will attempt to perform Lift Qi Up, Pour Qi down four times and enjoy the benefits of its relaxing effect.
Not to worry, if you feel tired, just pull a chair and continue in a sitting position using the imagination method.
We will pair up at the end and enjoy the healing benefits of the built up Qi field in LaQi practice. It's a wonderful opportunity for beginners to experience the repetition and to learn the movements of
Lift Qi Up, Pour Qi down.

Donation $5.

People of all levels of experience are welcome.
This will be our last weekend meetup for the year of 2015.
See you soon!

Thanks
Peter.
results.name: Xmas 'Qigong Marathon Challenge'

Enjoy Exquisite Wines and Delicious Tapas!

At this tasting event you will have the opportunity to embark on a journey as we explore the flavors of South America. From Argentina we will be featuring the wines of Argento & Vistalba both from the Mendoza region which is known worldwide for their distinct flavors and premium products.

In recent years Uruguay has become a highly sought after destination for wine lovers, in part due to Bodega Garzon Wines and their production of the Tannat varietal with which you will enjoy at Wine Chateau.

Featuring:

Bodega Garzon, Sauvignon Blanc (94 Point Rates)

Bodega Garzon, Albarino (92 Point Rated)

Argento, Malbec Reserva (2015 Decanter Gold Medal)

Bodega Vistalba, Corte C (90 Point Rated)

Bodega Vistalba, Corte B (Best Buy Wine Spectator)

Bodega Garzon, Tannat (95 Point Rated)

results.description:
Periscope (owned by Twitter) and Meerkat are arguably the two most recent phenomenons in social media and video communication. Both apps have millions of users despite being less than one year old. Yet, jumping on it early can serve as a strategy to become a big fish in a small pond before it becomes saturated. For example, the biggest star on Periscope is Amanda Oleander. She has 500,000+ followers on Periscope and previoulsy took her 4 years to get 2000 fans on Instagram. I (Paul Rothbein) personally asked a friend of Amanda Oleander how she became so popular. His answer was "she created an account on day 2."

This will be an informal gathering to get started with Periscope/Meerkat and everyone is encouraged to first download both apps and see how it works in action. Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/understanding-live-video-streaming-with-periscope-and-meerkat-tickets-19889529117
results.name: Understanding Live Video Streaming with Periscope and Meerkat

results.description:
Let's meet for some Holiday cheer at the Met Museum's Great Hall Balcony Bar and listen to a combination of 20th century music (Piazzolla) and older Holiday music (Bach and Schumann). Admission to the bar is free with Museum Admission,  a suggested donation.


ETHEL and Friends is a music series specifically designed for the Museum's Balcony Bar

ETHEL is one of the most acclaimed string quartets in the contemporary classical field. With an eye on tradition and an ear to the future, ETHEL is a leading force in concert music's reengagement with musical vernaculars, fusing diverse traditions into a vibrant sound. Expect familiar classical tunes mixed with a fair share of the group's signature, cutting-edge repertoire. Guest artists and collaborators will also make periodic appearances. Relax and enjoy cocktails and appetizers while looking out over the majestic Great Hall.

Friday, December 18, 2015
The Larch Ensemble

Ralph Farris, violin & viola
Dorothy Lawson, cello
Stephen Gosling, piano

Works by Schumann, Piazzolla, Bach, Holiday favorites
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet at the entrance of the Balcony Bar on the second floor of the museum.
results.name: MetLiveArts ETHEL and Friends

It's a great opportunity to finish those started projects!


No time to crop? Come by and shop! The store will be open from 3:00 PM to 10:00 PM.


Terms and Conditions: Payment for in-store crops must be made in advance. In the event that you are unable to attend and a replacement is not found for you, payment will be forfeited. We reserve the right to cancel a crop that does not meet minimum enrollment requirements. results.description:
After a long week of monotonous working/coding, you just want to do something cool.  Come join us push our projects to the next level or bring your own.  All are welcome, and the only real requirements are that you respect other peoples projects, speed of development, and find ways to contribute positive energy.

Itinerary:
5pm - Early birds can start working at 5pm, with little interruption.
6pm - Orientation / Team Placement for free agents
7pm - Dinner Ordering
8:45pm - Presentation (optional)
9:30pm - Rap UP (possible shift DownStairs to Port Morris Distillery for those of age who'd like a drink)

Featured Projects:
Fananza.com / KrinkledGifts.com - NY/CHI ecommerce startup

TheKingSlayer.com - A platform dedicated to the Gamer Lifestyle

SideHop - NY Startup for on-demand valet services

ThisistheBronx - under development Crowdsourced content library

Youbewa Media / PortMorrisMedia.com - Variety of photography and media services.

ANYONE WHO WANTS TO JOIN A PROJECT OR BRING ONE, PLEASE DON'T HESITATE TO REACH OUT TO ME (Darnell).

results.description: We will see the play "Incident At Vichy" by Arthur Miller at the Signature Theatre at 480 West 42 Street. I read this play eons ago & was very affected by it. We will each purchase our own tickets, which cost $55 or $75, depending on the seat. You can buy yours online or by phone at an additional $4.50 booking fee & $2 facility fee, or at the box office at no extra charge. The website is www.signaturetheatre.org, and the phone no. is[masked]-7529. The play is at 7:30 PM, & we will meet for dinner at 5:30PM at a nearby as of yet undetermined restaurant. The tickets have been selling like hotcakes, so, if you are interested, it's best to RSVP and get your ticket quickly!  BTW, I have set an early RSVP deadline of Fri., 12/4/15 to maximize our chances of getting a Friday night restaurant reservation in the theatre district in December, 1 week before Christmas!
results.name: Let's Meetup and see the play "Incident At Vichy" by Arthur Miller

results.description:
A FREE and mostly vegan community meals we make together with love, mostly using food we rescued from the trash. We share meal planning, cooking, and other food prep skills, tell stories and jokes, meet new people and reconnect with old friends, and generally unplug from the current world order as we build community. If you are not a skilled cook, it is OK! If you are, that’s great! You can plan a dish or two from the ingredients we have on hand, and get help if you want it. All participants should plan to help in some way, even if other commitments prevent you arriving on time. Media WILL be welcome with appointment, but journalists will be required to respect the wishes of those who do not want to be photographed.

Special this month, we will have a no-pressure freegan gift exchange in conjunction with our feast.  Bring any wrapped items (newspaper wrapping is fantastic!) that you may have and not want and could be of use to someone else. These items can also be found from other places as well.  If you have a surplus of items, feel free to bring more than one so that those who come to the feast can participate even if they did not bring anything.

It will be held at a volunteer’s home accessible by NYC Transit. RSVP (at least a day ahead) to Janet at (347)[masked] for the location. We’ll meet at 5:30pm to begin cooking and preparation.

If you arrive at an event and cannot find us, call Janet at (347) 724-6954.
results.name: Freegan Feast and freegan holiday gift exchange

results.description:
Date Walking is kind of like speed dating except not as awkward, not as frantic and a heck of a lot more relaxed. When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of about an hour. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face. You can check out some photos from previous Date Walks here. 

I don't know about you, but the last thing I want to do after work on a Friday is commute home in a packed subway car. Will you join us for a Chinatown Dumpling Crawl? I know that you will. Only a crazy person would pass up a dumpling crawl. 

While this event is geared towards singles in the 21 to 49 age range, anyone is welcome to come. 

We will meet in front of Starbucks located at 291 Broadway at 5:30 PM and we will wait 20 minutes for everyone to arrive. As you can see, there are numerous subway stops near the meeting spot. You've got the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, A, C, R, J and Z trains. That's a lot of options! 

The dumpling joints we will be crawling to are not sit down places and even if they are, we will not be sitting and eating. I mean, maybe if there is a table available, the ladies in the group can sit there, but for most of us, it will be a stand-and-eat-type deal. Also, the places we will be visiting are all super cheap! I'm talking about 5 to 10 dumplings for $1 to $3. Yes I'm serious. 

After our crawl we can get drinks somewhere. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter 

Please be aware that while an equal number of men and women is preferred it is not always the case.
results.name: Date Walk: Chinatown Dumpling Crawl

results.description:
Can You Solve this Room Escape?

New York Police Office just obtained information that Dr. Snake has a secret laboratory in the sewage system of the city. Dr. Snake has been researching on the development of a new neurotoxin, which may cause great harm to the residents of the city. Now you need to enter the sewage system, find the laboratory and find a cure to the neurotoxin.

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/ntM26w

results.description:
NewSpace NYC is excited to have Honeybee Robotics for our final #SpaceTalk of 2015! Mars mission and the future missions with NASA. You don't want to miss out on this lecture!

Agenda:


• History of Honeybee Robotics in New York

• Overview of work in 1980s and 1990s: spacecraft mechanisms and on-orbit assembly

• Legacy of planetary exploration: Mars, Venus, and Lunar technologies

• Honeybee today: Spacecraft subsystems and next-generation planetary exploration technologies

results.name: Manhattan to Mars: Robotic Space Exploration in the New Age of Discovery

results.description:
This is a free event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase stylish and fashionable tech products. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope. A great way to get publicity and a great way for video content creators to film content about futuristic products that might change the world. Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Product). The event is in collaboration with Futurites and Allwomenstalk.com. It is encouraged for people to showcase by wearing their fashionable tech product. You are also welcome to bring a table to showcase your fashionable tech gear.
All products will be related to fashion and tech that one cannot find on the mass market. Expect to see products in the field of wearables, 3D printed designs, and eco-friendly clothing. All products must have a tech and stylish component to it. In addition, we will have prizes and gifts (pending) for whoever has the most unique and innovative fashionable tech product to the event. Prizes will not be given to anyone that brings a product made by a third party.
The event will also be broadcasted online and will be live from where the event takes place in Manhattan. Please RSVP to attend online or follow @perspective2025 on Periscope.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/futurites-style-tech-and-content-creators-tickets-19722296921

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

Christmas is just around the corner, but there is just enough time to squeeze in another meetup! 

Due to popular demand, we will return to Holland House on 5th Ave at 30th St. after the last event at a new venue was a bit loud & a bit hot, so I hope to welcome you all back to Holland House, where things went nice and smooth 2 months ago!

NOTE: When opening a tab, especially while seated at a table, make sure the staff understands that is YOUR PERSONAL TAB ONLY so no-one accidentally adds items to your bill.

VICE VERSA: If a staff member serves you without asking for cash or card, make sure to approach them to avoid someone else having to foot your bill.

Beers

Holland House is famous for their beer selection: About 150 beers are available: 35 on draft, and over 100 bottle beers.

If you are the adventurous type, they have a whole selection of beer cocktails as well.

Happy Hour

$5 for select draft beers until 07:00PM

For our group only, they will extend the Happy Hour until 08:00PM.

Please see me at the event before you go to the bar after 07:00PM.

Usually about 10 beers are listed on the Happy Hour menu.

Food

Yes, they also have a food menu. We will have some high tables reserved for us, so you will have a place to put down your plate if you decide to order food.

Cover Charge?

None! Our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

How do I get there by train?

N/R - 28th St: 3 blocks

6 - 28th St: 4 blocks

B/D/F/M/Q - 34th St Herald Sq: 4 blocks

1 - 28th St: 4 blocks (a bit further than the others)

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

I hope to see plenty of you guys, and if not, have a Merry Christmas, Happy Holidays, a Great New Year!!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
A suggested event

Join Martin Mawyer, president of Christian Action Network and Guido Lombardi, president of the North Atlantic League for the presentation of:

Europe’s Last Stand - America's Final Warning.

Europe's Last Stand is a shocking and graphic documentary by an American film company that examines the Islamic invasion of Western Europe and its threat to European democracy, freedoms, culture and history. 

The film was recently broadcast in Europe, where it lit up social media. Critics are calling it an "earthquake documentary."

A continent that once gave birth to the greatest advances in world civilization is now on the verge of being extinguished by an unmatched foe of religious zealots who are on a quest to establish an Islamic Caliphate over Europe.

Now, for the fist time ever, Europe’s Last Stand uncovers the Five Pillars of Islamic Conquest in an extraordinary film that documents the Islamic strategy for dominating Western Europe! 

The film is presented in five parts, revealing each of the Five Pillars of Islamic Conquest: Infiltration. Imams. Isolation. Islamization. Implosion.

Europe’s Last Stand is an epic film about the heroes and villains, the champions and quitters, the bold and the weak in this life-and-death struggle for the heart and soul of Western Europe.

With over four years in the making – and a over dozen European countries visited and investigated – Europe’s Last Stand is the most authoritative film ever produced documenting the rise of Islam in Western Europe. 

Violence…Protests…Arrests… they are all joined together with scores of eyewitness and expert testimonies from politicians, activists, business owners and everyday citizens to tell the story of Europe’s Last Stand.

PRB Films, in Association with Christian Action Network, is an American non-profit documentary film company based in Lynchburg, Virginia.

Watch trailer here.

Have questions about Europe's Last Stand: America's Final Warning?

Contact Christian Action Network with North Atlantic League

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
End the year by welcoming new members and allies of Indie R at this landmark U.E.S building on Lex.  Just two short blocks from the 4,5,6. 

We have the entire ballroom. So you'll have plenty of time and elbow space to make new connections and catch-up with current ones. Bring business cards.

--------------------------------------------------------------------
Evening Highlights:

• 6.00 - 9.30 pm. Buffet Social (Dinner Theater style) Enjoy the organizer talks, complimentary food and conversations with fellow freedom lovers.  

Food and beverages supplied by Dulce Vida (Colombian cuisine)

• 7.00 - 7.30 pm. Soapbox segment (limited to 3 minutes per speaker) for members who wish to encourage the group or share useful grassroots intel.

Special guest: Deborah Coughlin, President of Metropolitan Republican Club will give you a brief overview of her grassroots organization. 

*Owing to the coalition nature of the group, Indie R will refrain from making an official group endorsement of the candidates during the Primary. Feel free to discuss your personal choice respectfully among yourselves.  

•  8.00 - 8.15 pm. Insider News: Joe C, our resident Albany insider, will serve you a summary of  Cuomo's legislative shenanigans in 2015.  We'll also let you know what to expect for 2016 federal + local politics. 

8.30 - 8.45 pm Closing Remarks   Perseus Hoang will give a quick intro on what sets Indie R apart, upcoming projects and how you can get involved.  

--------------------------------------------------------------------
Admission is free. Donations welcome to help cover the event. 

Full program and complimentary menu to be posted shortly. 

---------------------------------
results.name: 3rd Annual Christmas Beer & Buffet Social

results.description:
End the year by welcoming new members and allies of Indie R at this landmark U.E.S building on Lex.  Just two short blocks from the 4,5,6. 

We have the entire ballroom. So you'll have plenty of time and elbow space to make new connections and catch-up with current ones. Bring business cards. 

Evening Highlights: 

1. Buffet + Beer Social Enjoy the complimentary food and conversations with fellow freedom lovers.  

2. Soapbox segment (limited to 3 minutes per speaker) for members who wish to encourage the group or share useful grassroots intel. 

*Owing to the coalition nature of the group, Indie R doesn't plan to make any endorsement of the candidates during the primary election. Feel free to discuss your personal choice respectfully among yourselves. 

3. Insider News: Joe C, our resident Albany insider, will serve you a summary of  Cuomo's legislative shenanigans in 2015.  We'll also let you know what to expect for 2016 federal + local politics. 

4. Closing Remarks Perseus Hoang will give a quick intro on what sets Indie R apart, upcoming projects and how you can get involved.  

Admission is free. Donations welcome to help cover the event. 

Full program and complimentary menu to be posted shortly. 


---------------------------------
results.name: 3rd Annual Christmas Beer & Buffet Social hosted by the Indie Republican Meetup

venue.address_1: 372 Fifth Ave, Apt 9F Enter on 35th St
venue.name: PupScouts Buttercup and Lukas' apartment

results.description:
It's that time of year again, PupScouts!! Time to PAWTY!!!!!!Come and party with the PupScout and see if you'd like to join our Troop.


PupScouts Lukas & Buttercup have once again generously offered their place for us to get together!!! Thanks to their Mom, Ami, too!!!!


Please bring a wrapped gift to put under the Tree if you'd like to participate in the Gift Exchange - bring a gift ($20 value, please), get a gift - that seemed to work out last year! No obligation to bring a gift unless you'd like to participate in the Gift Exchange.  Presents should be for humans.p

Other details you need to know - $5 meeting fee and Ugly Sweaters for both Pups and Humans.  No need to bring your uniforms this time, we're just partying!

Looking forward to meeting YOU.
results.how_to_find_us: Tell the doorman you are going to Ami's apartment.  Please put a belly band on your boy dog before you come into the apartment to avoid any embarrassments.
results.name: PupScouts Holiday party!

results.description:
Experience the Best Craft Cocktails in NYC

This Happy Hour tour will bring you to the center of New York’s booming cocktail culture as we visit some of the best cocktail bars in the city.

Along the way we will sample delicious libations, swap tales of speakeasies and gangsters, shop for new local craft spirits, learn how to make craft cocktails, and discover some of the best places to grab a drink in the Big Apple.

It’s a great way to start off an unforgettable evening in New York City!

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/Uyu2L6
results.name: New York Craft Cocktail Tour

results.description:
We want to celebrate the closing of a year and the beginning of another. We want to celebrate our new members and reconnect with existing members.  Come and share your accomplishments for 2015 and your next goals for 2016. 

Attend our End of Year celebration and bring a screenwriter, director, grip, editor etc...filmmaker friend.
results.name: End of Year Mix & Mingle

results.description:
Play 3v3, 4v4, and 5v5 indoor soccer for an hour on the best turf product in the city.

Everything provided (e.g., EPL ball and pillowy soft pinnies) - including warm and dry-conditions.

Before coming, please read the facility rules here: http://www.thepitchbrooklyn.com/rules/

* No plastic molded cleats and no metal cleats are allowed on the pitch. You can wear rubber-studded cleats, indoor shoes and sneakers.

* Shin guards are also required.

* Cash-only payments this week.

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.description:
For our Fall/Winter sessions, we shall play with only 2 TEAMS

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, a sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for an hour and half. 


• Lime green colored pinnies (practice jerseys) will be provided for one of the teams to diffrentiate teams.

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Join us at El Taller Latino Americano/The Latin American Workshop for the last Spanish Conversation Meet-up of 2015! 

Come and practice your Spanish with us while you learn about Latin American holiday and end of the year traditions! Ven y celebra con nosotros con pastelitos, musica y español. 

All levels are welcome. Conversation will be facilitated by native speakers. Meet-ups are held every other Friday from 6-7PM. Please check the calendar for future dates or contact us at[masked]!

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
Movie- Trainwreck: comedy

We will hang out, eat snacks, watch movie and hang out some more. 

Please bring a snack or beverage to share with others. Feel free to bring dinner for yourself in case you haven't eaten dinner.

To get to Brian's apartment:

The best way is to take the 7 train to 90th street Station. Exiting  the train, walk to the left and then, make a right onto 89th street. You will walk straight down 89th street past four avenues until you reach Northern boulevard. 

As you keep walking on 89th street, you will pass a red Santander bank. My place is across the street from a small park on 89th street.

**Please note it is a 10 minute walk in total to my place.  
Please note I do have a cat named Chewy who looks forward to meeting you.

Press buzzer 23

Take elevator to 5th floor. Make a right through the grey fire door and walk to the end of the hall to apartment 510.


There are other ways to get to my place but I think this is the simplest since you only take the 7 train and walk straight down 89th street to my apartment.

Matchmaker -- where couples are made.

We are back for a Van Diemen's Friday. Please join us to mingle with other singles. Have a drink, or two, with us (food is delicious as well ;) ). And get into a holiday spirit. :)
results.name: Matchmaker Holiday Party

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
Busy finishing last minute shopping and making sure everyone and everything is taken care off . In the midst of all the holiday activity; we lose sight of ourselves and instead of really enjoying and being happy during this season of celebration we may in reality be stressing out and not relaxing . Come join us for a session of relaxation through breathing techniques and meditation. It will recharge and rejuvenate you so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. Gift yourself this holiday season. Take the time to be Happy and Peaceful.  This 90 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.
results.name: Gift Yourself Happiness

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is just a fun way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1PGAMkv

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1QBvNCq

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize. 


At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games, & Scorecard Matching  

•  Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.  

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1PGAMkv

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1QBvNCq

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 


Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. Food and drink will be available for purchase.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase a ticket in advance at these links (no tix sold at door) -

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1PGAMkv

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1QBvNCq
results.name: Singles Pool Night - PREPAY ONLY (SOLD OUT FOR MEN!)

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5949 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 


At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


PREPAYMENT at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5949 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: Speed Pool (Billiards) NYC- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

results.name: Singles Pool Night - PREPAY ONLY (SOLD OUT FOR MEN!)

results.description:
BlackLightBall, it's like regular indoor soccer but under the BlackLights and with music!! This is our Monthly BLB event (3rd Sat of the Month) at this location. 

This is a fun laid back social event. You can come later if that fits your schedule better, no problem.  We will have music playing, there will be healthy snacks and drinks, and we will be playing indoor soccer till the sun goes down. Once it's dark enough we will switch over to BlackLightBall for the rest of the evening. You can play as much or little as you like. When you get off the court and you would like to play again just get back into the line. Otherwise if you like, take a break, eat a snack, socialize, and watch others play a game. It's all for fun and to raise funds for Street Soccer USA.

WHITE T-SHIRT IS A MUST.  (Shorts, socks, shoes - the more white or fluorescent colors the better)
BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS.
PINNIES WILL BE PROVIDED but sometimes you will be wearing just the white shirt.

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match! 

Rules:


8min games

Fun Play 

No Sliding 

Game restarts from goalie 

Kick-ins.. no throw ins

Corner kicks 

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.  Use the comments section to arrange carpooling if you like. Typically there is at least a group doing a car pool from the Court Square/Murray Playground area in LIC.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route. 

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.


The fee is  $10 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game. 


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.


If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play. 

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers Help USA nor Street Soccer USA are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Holiday BlackLightBall Charity Social 6:30pm - Ward's Island for SSUSA

results.description:
Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5949 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 


At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


PREPAYMENT at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5949 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


PREPAYMENT at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5949 is required 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games, & Scorecard Matching  

•  Ice Breakers 

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.  

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1PGAMkv

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1QBvNCq

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. Food and drink will be available for purchase.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and buy ticket at these links -

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1PGAMkv

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1QBvNCq

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops and practice Spanish in a fun and natural way. In the spirit of the season, we'll have a free raffle and refreshments.

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

What's going on?

2015 has almost come to an end, so let’s celebrate with an end-of-the-year party! This multi-cultural exchange is the perfect opportunity to practice both English and Japanese. We will celebrate a great season and meet new people while doing so.

Here are some of the things that will be available:

- Food

- Games

- Face Paint

- Calligraphy

- Language Exchange

When & Where:

Date: Friday December 19th, 2015, from 6:45pm-9:15pm

Location: 6th Floor @ Chelsea Studios, 151 West 26th Street, New York, NY 10001

Price:The price for attending this event is $10.00 per person.

To RSVP, email us at: [masked]

詳細


忘年会2015年もあと少しで終わりますね！！年の暮れにＪＣＡＧメンバーと一緒にお祝いできればと思い、ＪＣＡＧ忘年会を開催することになりました。英語、日本語の練習の絶好の機会に！また新しいメンバーさん達との交流の場に！お友達を連れてご参加下さい！

当日は以下を予定しております。

- 軽食

- ゲーム

- フェイスペイント

- 英語と日本語の交流

results.description:
Because we've got only two weeks between the "November" and December meets, we're reading a novella. Please read Resnick's "Seven Views of Olduvai Gorge" a Hugo (1995) and Nebula (1994) winner (among many other awards), and Caryn's pick. "In the far future, eons after the demise of Humanity and its far-flung galactic empire, a group of alien archeologists visits Earth to uncover the secret of the dead race’s initial overwhelming success and its ultimate death.

Digging through layers of archeological strata at Olduvai Gorge, they discover seven unique artifacts, each related to a different era of humanity’s history and each telling a unique story about humankind’s strengths and weaknesses.

But are they prepared for their final discovery, which will change their worlds forever?"
(Blurb from Amazon)

Location TBA - West Orange/Montclair area

results.description:
Many people new to the term think that permaculture is just a fancy gardening technique. This month's Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup features recent PDC graduate Chloé Rossetti impressively showing how permaculture can be applied to our social and urban landscape. Join us!


In this presentation, I propose a wellness collective and business that retrofits the life of its clients and members to align them with the principles of permaculture. I imagine a zone system of wellness care, beginning with Zone 0 (the self), extending outward to our inputs, environment, nonhuman allies, human allies, and strangers, reworking our relationships at every stage to encourage regeneration, abundance, and healing. I also propose a test site for the business that is a multi-person brownstone in upper Manhattan, packed with permacultural initiatives, holistic health workshops, and community programming.Finally, I imagine a financial structure for the company that redistributes resources to the margin, and also monetizes and financially values care labor, in the spirit of Wages for Housework, as a way to subvert capitalism while functioning inside of it. It is my hope that we can learn to live regeneratively in urban environments.


Chloé Rossetti is a writer, artist, and budding permaculturist based in New York. Her practice in energy healing and somatics has recently led her to contemplate reparative systems that extend beyond the human body into socio-ecological realms. Chloé is currently focusing on a scalable wellness modality and test site that integrates personal healing with environmental regeneration and bioremediation. Chloé is a fall 2015 graduate of Center for Bioregional Living's permaculture design course <a>www.permaculturenewyork.com.</a>

results.description:
Join us for the NY Shamanic Healing Circle with Irma StarSpirit Woman

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

Dates for circle are:  Nov. (No Circle) & Dec. 18.

Location: YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W. 29th St, 2nd Fl., #201 (btw. 7th & 8th Ave), NYC.(door closes at 7:30pm)

Exchange: $20

Register to hold space email: [masked]

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com

results.description:
Movie Night! Yangsi

Friday December 18, 7pm

Recognized as the reincarnation (‘yangsi’) of Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, one of the most revered Tibetan Masters of the 20th century, Ugyen Tenzin Jigme Lhundrup must train to perpetuate this legacy, starting with an enthronement before thousands at age four. ‘Yangsi’ follows this process, from childhood up to the time he embarks on a world tour at the age of eighteen to fully assume the mantle of his predecessor. Filmed in large part in Himalayan Kingdom of Bhutan, over a period of 14 years, Yangsi tells a unique coming of age story as it explores the doubts and hesitations along with the unusual strength of character of the ‘Yangsi’.

Please enjoy this fascinating film with us. Bring something to eat or drink for our potluck table. Movie Night is free and open to the public. Our space is small, so please arrive on time. 

RSVP at [masked].
results.name: Movie Night! Yangsi

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here. 


Student Work - Sherry B.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:

Rosie's serves up Chef Marc Meyer's thoughtful approach to the bold, complex flavors of Mexico, a country he has extensively explored and long admired. Along with chefs Angel Andrade (Cookshop) and Chester Gerl (Hundred Acres and Five Points), Meyer prepares bright, straightforward dishes made using traditional techniques, including grinding fresh masa and cooking on a comal.

http://rosiesnyc.com/


RSVPs:


Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Rosie's - Mexican Food

results.description:
Dixon Place Presents:
Bring an object that you can hide behind, or that actually showcases part of the real you, and share its tale in 3 minutes or less at our first Show & Tale event to be held at Dixon Place, a very special and magical performance venue on the Lower East Side.

FREE: We'll be passing the hat to support a wonderful improv theater program for able bodied & disabled students called IDEAS: http://ideasdrama.org/

Is Halloween your favorite holiday and do you own a collection of dozens of masks and have one particular one that you cherish? Did an ancestor love to go to masquerade balls & you have photos or newspaper clippings of them? Did you love to act in school plays and save the costume from the first play that you had a leading role in? Do you still have the middle-aged lady outfit and accessories that you wore to a bachelor party on a dare in 1983, after Dustin Hoffman starred in “Tootsie”? Or are you actually a drag queen/king who makes a living as a cabaret singer/performer, and want to share about your “lucky” fake eyelashes or mustache?

Bring these, and any other object related to concealing, disguising, or veiling and show & share its story. There are no judges for the best tale… no need to practice.. simply show an object that connects to your hidden or revealed self. And of course you don’t have to show & tell... just come to look & listen.

More info: http://dixonplace.org/performances/show-tale-masks-costumes-all-that-drag/

https://www.facebook.com/events/1026909667360756/
results.name: Show & Tale: Masks, Costumes & All that Drag

Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description: As we have entered a particularly violent stage of civilization, we face a critical challenge. The threats of nuclear war, catastrophic climate change and a merciless chain of terrorism can be summarized as peace or perish. Most people have a one-dimensional mind, and their response to the violence is often another outburst of violence, leading to an endless state of warfare. While religious people may think in terms of the last days or Armageddon, secular people see the decline of civilization. What is the humanist response to this predicament and what are the chances of success? Humanist counselor Joseph Ben David has acquired an enormous amount of unique research, experience and wisdom in this field and will share it in this lecture-discussion meeting. Followed by socializing and light refreshments. A program of the Humanist Foundation. Information:[masked]-5662. www.HumanistFoundation.org
results.name: Humanism: For the Sake of Life in a Time of Terrorism

results.description:
Please join us for the screening of the documentary "Unmosqued," which examines the realities and issues that prevent many Muslims from going to a mosque. More and more Muslims feel they don't belong in traditional places of worship that retain strong ties to homelands that self-identified American Muslims do not relate to. Similarly, many women feel marginalized, oppressed and unwelcome at mosques.  

Some of the issues raised by this film are: 

--Mosques are simply not welcoming for many people who don’t see financial or leadership transparency. 

--Mosques are not warm places and are not spiritually uplifting.

--Racism and ethnocentrism are off-putting to Millenials who are the most racially diverse American generation in history. 

--Young people don’t feel heard by mosque leaders. 

--Women’s spaces are typically unwelcoming.

--The prevalence of spiritual abuse from leaders ill-equipped to handle social problems of their congregants.

We will watch this documentary together and then have a discussion about it. Please feel free to bring healthy snacks to share after the screening. 

We ask attendees to contribute $5 each for the rental of the location. 

http://www.unmosquedfilm.com/press-kit/
results.how_to_find_us: Location is between Madison and Park. Please ring Buzzer 1.
results.name: Screening of Unmosqued

results.description:
What’s it all about? Is spirituality part of your everyday life? How do you find it? Each monthly conversation will focus on a specific topic or question to guide the conversation.

Upcoming topic:    Is Life a Random Walk? 
Do you ever wonder what the purpose of life is, is there more to life than meets the eye, if your experiences have meaning, and even if life matters at all? There are so many questions—all good ones—about who you are and where are you going. On the surface, life can certainly seem unfair at times. Are our challenges random?  Or, are they part of a much larger scheme of things where life is perfectly balanced? Perhaps we can discover ways to more easily navigate life and be compassionate and loving even when times are tough. Hear what this means to others and express what you’ve been thinking about questions and ideas like these in regard to your own life..

Please join us for this open discussion format—come to explore ideas, share your experiences, ask questions, or hear from others. Our goal is to learn from and honor each other’s spiritual insights in a relaxed and comfortable environment. We look forward to meeting you for the first time or seeing you again. Feel free to bring a friend.

This Meetup repeats on the 3rd Friday of every month at the same location and time. Look for our future postings, including conversations on these topics: The Quest for Truth … Is Life a Random Walk? … Dreams are Real—What is Their Purpose? … You Have Lived Before—Past Lives and Karmic Ties…What’s Love Got to Do With It? … When Love Replaces Fear … Are There Spiritual DOs and DON’Ts? … Soul Travel and Out-of-Body Experiences … Awaken to Greater Spirituality in Your Life … An Intimate Relationship with God

Panera Bread at 15 Bloomfield Ave. Montclair, NJ 
(In Glenmont Square next to 7-ELEVEN; parking available)


For information on other events being held throughout the state,
visit www.eckankar-nj.org
results.how_to_find_us: In Glenmont Square next to 7-ELEVEN; parking available
results.name: Is Life a Random Walk? - Conversation on Spirituality

results.description:
Bodies in Motion, a performance art event taking place on Friday, December 18th at 7:30pm. Artists and engineers from the Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP) and the Integrated Digital Media Program (IDM) will debut installations and performances that address notions of spectatorship and human interaction in the age of ubiquitous digital media. It is the first collaboration of this kind between Tisch School of the Arts and Tandon School of Engineering.

The performance acknowledges the cultural and societal significance of new media and highlights the border of real and virtual, presence and performance, observation and participation. Bodies in Motion confronts the idea of spectacle, rethinking motion capture technology and its representation through dance and immersive environments.

Based on the structure of Allan Kaprow’s 1969 performance, “18 Happenings in Six Parts,” Bodies in Motion is divided into different environments—each one independent, yet relating to the others in a synthesized whole of motion capture technology. The event consists of live motion capture dance, virtual reality installations, and participatory performances designed through cutting-edge visual tools to immerse the audience in play. Bodies in Motion will take place at NYU’s Media and Games Network (MAGNET) on the 8th Floor of 2 MetroTech Center in downtown Brooklyn. The event is free of charge


https://www.facebook.com/events/144432212581425/
results.name: Bodies In Motion (Ticket Required)

results.description:
Discover the fun of Contra Dance - an easy to learn, lively social dancing that will make you smile! Free lesson at start of dance, with live music and experienced caller. No partner needed! Cost is $12 (I believe. That is what it was in the October dance.) Wear soft-soled shoes or sneakers, and comfortable clothes that will let you swing and turn. Melanie Axel-Lute calling, and music by the Gotham Gals, at the monthly Friday night contra in Chestnut Ridge, NY, right across the NYNJ border:
Green Meadow Waldorf School Gym, chestnut Ridge Road between Hungry Hollow Road and Joyce Drive .
Chestnut Ridge, NY 10977
Enter gym parking lot off of Route 45 (Chestnut Ridge Road) -- note that
the address given on Facebook and the automatic address filler in Meetup (below) for the school is 307 Hungry Hollow Road but go instead to the intersection of Hungry Hollow Road and Chestnut Ridge Road, the dance is in the gym of Green Meadow Waldorf school-- park in the lot up there. The school is actually on the corner of Hungry Hollow Road and Chestnut Ridge Road (just south of the Hungry Hollow Co-op, whose address is 841 Chestnut Ridge Rd, Spring Valley, NY 10977--not far from Joyce Drive)
Google "Contra Dance" to see youtube videos of this dance form. It This is not line dancing or square dance, though some contra dance moves are similar to square dance. The dance is descended from English Country dancing, but is faster and more fun, a great way to meet a lot of people who love music and dance. And I think it is a lot more fun! -- See announcement at https://www.facebook.com/contradancechestnutridge/
