results.description:
This is our Asia Business Network monthly meeting. We meet at a location near Grand Central in Midtown Manhattan for business networking. We are joined by English students from Asia, who are either working or studying as professionals in Banking, Business, Economics, and Finance. They are in America learning English and are interested in business relationships with Asians in America.

There are networking activities and a conversation topic is introduced to the group. There is a short lecture and there is discussion on the conversation topic. The conversation topic is always Asian Banking, Business, Economics, or Finance related!  Asian business current events are introduced to the group, and economic issues that are important to Asians in America are discussed. Social networking time is also given.

There is going to be an Asian language exchange and there is English language instruction offered at this event.

At the end of the meeting the group is invited to go to Karaoke, or an Asian club, bar, or pub. The location is usually in China Town or Korea Town.

The number of English students in the meetup is given to the right of the event organizers name as pluses to the meeting. The students include a large number of graduate students from Columbia and NYU.  Erik is the host of the event. Erik has had years of experience in hosting Asian events in New York. Erik is a established member of the Asian community in the area and he improves networking performance by encouraging social networking and giving coaching for relationship building.

Translation Services: There is a Chinese - English translator in the group, whose services are for members in need of them. There is a Vietnamese translator whose services are offered upon request. The group is planning on adding a Japanese - English and Korean - English translator also. Erik the organizer is also familiar with Indonesian and Mongolian. Indonesian and Mongolian translation services are also going to be offered upon request. Translation services are free.

When the monthly attendance for this event exceeds 30, it is going to be made a weekly event.

There is a $5.00 fee for attending this event.

Thank you,
Erik
The Asian Business Network Organizer
results.name: Asia Business Network's Monthly Social!

group.name: The Asia Business Network!  (China, Japan, Korea, etc.)

results.description:
Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.
Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct experience.
Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual practice are welcome. 
Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner (prasadam) served

Admission to each meetup is free. Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.


1. Please RSVP. Location only given on phone [masked]

results.description:
Come celebrate the holidays at Lauren's apartment!

This party is a vegan cookie/treat swap, so you can bring your own holiday goodies and sample everyone else's! You need not show up with 4 dozen cookies; just a dozen or two will be adequate. Smaller sizes are better since everyone will want to sample a wide variety of goodies. You can bring cookies or other treats, such as truffles, bars, tarts, etc. Homemade is always more fun, but nobody will complain if it's store-bought! (Psst...bring tupperware so you can bring goodies home with you!)

Don't want to bring treats? Bring wine instead! If you show up empty-handed, the bouncer* won't let you in.

*The bouncer is my cat.

The party is white and gold themed, so try to wear as much white and/or gold as you can. Because color themes are fun and white and gold are pretty.

Additionally, there may be rounds of Christmas song karaoke or various Christmas movies. And my cat will be wearing a Christmas bow. 

If you RSVP "yes," please commit. If you need to change to "no," please do so before the day of.
results.name: White & Gold Holiday Party & Cookie Swap

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

We normally meet EVERY 2ND AND 4TH FRIDAY

              (whether it's dinner or just dessert/drinks)

In addition, (after an initial round of “Scrabble”) THE 4TH WEEK OF EVERY MONTH, we enjoy TEAM TRIVIA, pitting two teams of those who want to play against each other in a battle of wits over totally insignificant information.

(Those who are not trivia aficionados continue their Scrabble competition.)

Afterward, for those who want to hang and chill, we play a short group game, chosen at random. (TABOO has been the latest "hot choice.")

ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

                          LET FUN BE #1!!!

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

This week we are going to enjoy the tasty burgers and booze at Mel's Burger Bar!

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
There is a discussion after the 37-minute film, and an early show at 6:30pm. Free tickets must be reserved at http://www.eventbrite.com/e/europes-last-stand-americas-final-warning-tickets-19639520334

Europe's Last Stand is a shocking and graphic documentary by an American film company that examines the Islamic invasion of Western Europe and its threat to European democracy, freedoms, culture and history. The film was recently broadcast in Europe, where it lit up social media. Critics are calling it an "earthquake documentary."

A continent that once gave birth to the greatest advances in world civilization is now on the verge of being extinguished by an unmatched foe of religious zealots who are on a quest to establish an Islamic Caliphate over Europe.

Now, for the fist time ever, Europe’s Last Stand uncovers the Five Pillars of Islamic Conquest in an extraordinary film that documents the Islamic strategy for dominating Western Europe! The film is presented in five parts, revealing each of the Five Pillars of Islamic Conquest: Infiltration. Imams. Isolation. Islamization. Implosion.

Europe’s Last Stand is an epic film about the heroes and villains, the champions and quitters, the bold and the weak in this life-and-death struggle for the heart and soul of Western Europe.

With over four years in the making – and a over dozen European countries visited and investigated – Europe’s Last Stand is the most authoritative film ever produced documenting the rise of Islam in Western Europe. Violence…Protests…Arrests… they are all joined together with scores of eyewitness and expert testimonies from politicians, activists, business owners and everyday citizens to tell the story of Europe’s Last Stand.
results.name: Europe’s Last Stand - America's Final Warning documentary and discussion

Typical evening schedule: 
20 Minutes Seated Meditation 
10 Min Walking Meditation 
10 Min Reading 
30 Min Sharing Circle 
Tea And Snacks till closing @ 11pm

We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

results.description:
The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? 

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact Ravi: http://www.meetup.com/members/66340112

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.name: TurnON Brooklyn

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Last week was the funnest class we've had yet. You guys rocked it. No joke. I did promised that I had a new move for you all to learn in addition to learning the basics. Well, I taught 3 new moves. Promise delivered :) This week we will do the basics (as usual) for people who have never taken the class before and for practice for those who have taken it. Of course, a different set of moves will be included as well for more fun.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Salsa sample from instructor:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EZi3Y62DtAE

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

Hudson Grille’s massive patio now comes equipped with a heated tent and a great bar to help you get your drink on, while your 3 DJs keep you singing and dancing all night long. Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing? Don’t worry you’ll have two other DJ’s to choose from so you never have to stop partying.
DJ Green : Top 40’s and crowd favorites
DJ Red : 80’s, 90’s and 2k throwbacks
DJ Blue : Hip Hop and EDM

Age Restriction: 21+

All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS
***Credit or debit card is necessary for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Heated Indoor Party @ Hudson Grille

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone

results.description:
Eastern Devil's Path

Starting Point:[masked], [masked]
End point:[masked], [masked]

The complete Devil's Path is one of the most challenging hikes North East has to offer. We'll only do the Eastern Half however. Aim is to finish reasonably well before dark, so the pace would be intermediate - about 2-2.5mph.


Things to bring:
- Proper layers (with a shell)
- Hiking poles
- Food and Water
- Headlamp
- map

We may encounter patches of ice, sometimes on boulders. So, if you're wary of slippery conditions, please bring crampons, or microspikes at the very least.

Liability Waiver:
Hiking in front/backcountry is an inherently dangerous activity and can cause serious bodily injury or even death. This is a volunteer-run activity and organizers are in no way responsible for any physical, mental injury or
property damage/loss thereof. By joining this activity, you accept that you've read and understood the description of this hike, including this waiver, and that you've done research about the possible risks involved, and would not fault the organizers for any omissions/errors in the description therein. You also understand that you're solely responsible for your own safety and well-being.

Also, please LEAVE NO TRACE.

results.name: Eastern Devil's Path (12 miles, 4500')

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Join Metroland Ski Club at Belleayre Saturday January9th. Lift tickets are only $30 when you preregister at MetrolandSkiClub@gmail. Meet in the Discovery Lodge between 8:00 - 9:30am near the Ski School and Information desks.

Ski or Board rentals with a helmet are $29. A group lesson is $15 and start at 10:00 or 1:00. Transportation is on your own.

The Metroland Ski Club is dedicated to Skiing More For Less. We welcome potential new members to join us on Saturday for a great day on the slopes. Attend one of our outings you can become a member. Its that easy.

Take a look at our website, Metrolandskiclub.com for all the discount lift ticket opportunities available to our members. There are more than 600 discount ski days available. All you have to do is show your Metroland Ski Club card at the lift ticket window to appreciate the savings.

You'll find the Metroland Ski Club a great fit if you want to Ski More For Less. Come join us at New York's Winters Snow Park. Its bound to be a great day. See you there !

Metrolandskiclub.com

results.description:
Experience 1 week fun in paradise on an exclusive Sailing Yacht or Catamaran.
You will sail all day, meet new people, and see new cities and villages.

How much does this cost?
$1090 – Regular sailing yacht, more sporty (Bavaria 50)
$1280 – Luxury catamaran, more space (Lagoon 400)

Meetup Discount:
Members of Meetup receive a discount of ca. EUR 50. Please go to www.sailingnations.com/yachts and use discount coupon “meetup” at checkout.

What is included:
Yacht Charter British Virgin Islands
Yacht deposit insurance
Professional Skipper
Final cleaning of Yacht
Bedsheets, pillows, and towels
Dinghy and outboard engine
Marina Fees at base
Welcome drink
Start Pack (incl. dishtowels, soap)
Professional Photographer
Sundowner Yacht parties

Extra cost:
Food for your boat est. €40-50 per person / week
Water for your boat est. €6-8 per person / week
Fuel for your boat est. €10-20 per person / week
Port fees est. €12-40 pp / week
Flight / transfers
Whatever you spend in the evenings when going out in restaurants & clubs (if you wish)

Who is going?
We are going with meetup from different cities and other international people. We will be about 2-8 yachts. The age group is between 30 and 48, most people are solo travelers, and the male/female ratio we aim to maintain at 50/50.

What is the route?
DAY 1, COOPER ISLAND
DAY 2, VIRGIN GORDA ISLAND
DAY 3, VIRGIN GORDA ISLAND
DAY 4, MARINA CAY
DAY 5, CANE GARDEN BAY
DAY 6, GREAT HARBOUR
DAY 7, THE BIGHT / NORMAN ISLAND

How do I get to Tortola, British Virgin Islands?
Please read following instructions: http://bit.ly/1HLmtYu

Will it be fun?

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: 

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

venue.name: Stanley Isaacs Senior Center

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) and is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, December 19th, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly. A light breakfast of juice, coffee, pastry and/or bagels will be offered.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly. 

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. The building is offset from the street (toward the FDR Drive), enter through sliding glass doors. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Avenue (uptown) or 2nd Avenue (downtown).

Thanks and see you there!

results.description:
ANTICIPATED HIKE IS ABOUT 5-6 MILES BUT MAY BE A BIT LONGER DEPENDING ON THE GROUP.


THE HIKE DOES REQUIRE ROCK SCRAMBLING. PLEASE EVALUATE YOUR OWN ABILITY AND BE GUIDED ACCORDINGLY.

Summary: This hike has amazing views and does involve rock scrambles. From parking head south along the cliff and catch the aqua blazed Long Path (LP). Shortly after reaching the LP turn left on the blue/white blazed Forest Trail and descend steep terrain on a series of switchbacks and stairs. At end of trail, turn left on the white blazed Shore Trail. The trail soon reaches a difficult, rocky area known as Giant Stairs. Be careful here as some rocks are not stable. After about a mile of rocks, you reach flat ground and pass Peanut Leap Falls (impressive after a rain, a trickle otherwise) and some ruins. Trail climbs here and reaches the LP again. For a more strenuous, scenic route, turn left on LP, cross bridge, climb steep section and return to parking. For an easier return, continue straight on LP to a distinct, unmarked trail that leaves to left (sign says To Park Office). Take this. At end turn left onto old Rt 9W (closed to vehicles) and return to parking lot.

Depending on the size of the group we may split up into two groups to allow the group hike at their own pace.

GPS COORDINATES MAY BE OFF A BIT SO FOLLOW DRIVING DIRECTIONS:

Take the Palisades Interstate Park north from the George Washington Bridge. Continue for 1.7 miles beyond Exit 2, and turn right at a sign for the State Line Lookout. Follow the access road for about half a mile until it ends at a large parking lot near the lookout. (If you are coming from the north on the Parkway, bear left just beyond Exit 3 and follow the signs for the lookout)

MINIMUM RECOMMENDED GEAR:

· Backpack (keep in mind we will be climbing and crawling over rocks so your pack should not be too heavy or too big)

· Hiking Poles

· Hiking shoes with good traction. The rocks can be slippery especially if it rains a day or two before the hike.

· Water at least 2-3 liters

· Snack and lunch

Please note modified directions below:

Leader: Bijoy Mechery, [masked], cell day of hike only[masked]
Meet: 10 AM at Mayapple Hill parking area. Hike 2 to 2 1⁄2 hours and 4 to 5 miles. Bring snack and water. Hiking boots required. Traction devices also required if there is snow cover. Plan to arrive by 9:45 am. Watch this site on the morning of December 19 for any last minute changes/cancellations.

If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
DIRECTIONS:
SOUTH MOUNTAIN RESERVATION, Milburn and West Orange, NJ
-From east of the park (westbound) on I-78: Take exit 50 B "Millburn" "Maplewood". At the end of the ramp, you must go right. Drive through 3 traffic lights, not counting the one at the end of the ramp. At the fourth light (Millburn Ave.), turn left. Drive to the second traffic light (the road makes a turn to the right and becomes a one way street called Essex Ave.). Turn right onto Lackawanna Place, go under the RR tracks, and you come almost immediately to Glen Ave. Turn left and go to the first traffic light and turn right onto Brookside Drive. Go a few miles and the name will change to Pleasant Valley Way.  At the intersection of Northfield Ave. & Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange turn left (west) onto Northfield Ave.  Go about .1 miles to park entrance on the right.  Follow the road to the Mayapple Hill parking area.
-From west of the park (eastbound) on I-78 or NJ 24: NJ 24 joins I[masked]/2 miles before exit 49B "Maplewood." At the end of the ramp you must go to the right on Springfield Ave. (NJ 124). At the first light in 0.4 miles, you must take a jug handle to the right in order to turn left onto Valley Street. At the next light in 0.3 miles turn, left onto Vauxhall Road. Proceed 0.2 miles to the next light which is Millburn Ave. and turn left Then follow the directions as in "From the east on Interstate 78” above.
-From north of the park (either eastbound or westbound) on I-280: Take exit 7. At the bottom of the ramp, Turn south (left) onto Pleasant Valley Way. Proceed 2.2 miles to the corner of Pleasant Valley Way and Northfield Ave.  Make a right turn (west) onto Northfield Ave.  Go about .1 miles to park entrance on the right.  Follow the road to the Mayapple Hill parking area.
results.name: HIKE - Mayapple Hill/So. Mtn Res., W. Orange

results.description:
As part of our ongoing group within a group - our Book Club meetup for December is scheduled for: Saturday, December 19th. The book of the month is: The Grownup by Gillian Flynn (With the busy holiday season upon us, I thought we would read a short story instead of a novel.)

Amazon Book Overview/Summary:
''If you've read Gone Girl (and odds are you have) you know Gillian Flynn’s talent for playing cat and mouse with her readers. In The Grownup she does it again but in only 62 pages. The narrator is a born and raised scam artist who sees a chance to leave light sex work behind for a career in what she does best, reading people and telling them what they want to hear. Susan seems like the perfect mark--rich, desperate, and terrified of the evil she says lives in her house. But things are not what they seem, especially with Flynn at the helm. A short story written for George R.R. Martin’s Rogues anthology, The Grownup is a tightly wrought psychological thrill ride that will leave readers replaying every well spent moment.''

I look forward to seeing you all for a fun brunch and book discussion! :)
results.name: December Book Club Brunch

Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is dance walking? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. results.description:
**This is a Multi-Group Event so you will be meeting all sorts of interesting new friends at this event led by Event Host Tim ***

The original tour featuring the photos of the original Village Voice photographer Fred W. McDarrah. Based on a blockbuster photo exhibit of the same name that was on display at the Steven Kasher Gallery in Chelsea in 2014. So many individuals and groups came to the show, and there was such a positive media reaction to the exhibition and gallery workers were peppered on a daily basis with so many questions about the photos and the changing face of Greenwich Village....

  The exhibition ended, but the interest in Greenwich Village in the 1960s and McDarrah's documentation of the changing scene did not wane one iota. So the Estate of Fred W. McDarrah decided to bring the people not to the gallery, but to the scenes that made the show such a success: the Greenwich Village locales documented by McDarrah during his 50-year tenure at the Village Voice – such as Washington Square Park; the Stonewall Inn, the birthplace of the modern day gay rights movement; and the various stomping grounds of the individuals he photographed that helped shape the 1960s ethos, including Bob Dylan, Andy Warhol and Jimi Hendrix.

Each walker gets a FREE keepsake multi-postcard set of classic McDarrah images and the tours go to the same locations to see how they have changed,  how they are the same, and to hear the stories behind the famous photos. 

Click below to buy tickets and enter Promo Code MCDTOUR for 50% off!!! 

                                    ***CLICK HERE TO BOOK TOUR **

 Photo © 2015 Estate of Fred W. McDarrah  All Rights Reserved

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
So let's get a little exercise before the HVH Annual Insanity Party in Po-Kip-See.

Rain, snow, or winter conditions may modify or cancel this hike (and/or require the use of traction aides.)   I'll update when we get closer. 

NY'ers can take the 8:43 AM Hudson Line train from Grand Central arriving shortly after 10 at the Breakneck Ridge trailhead stop.  (Tell the conductor.)  If you are going to the HVH Party afterwards, we can carpool.  


No Guests.

Gear:   It's winter, remember!   Even if it's warm, bring extra clothing and keep it in your pack. 

Map:  NY/NJ Trail Conf. Map #102 or other Hudson Highland map.

Distance: Approx. 4-miles

Elevation Gain: Approx. 1,850 feet.  

The first mile involves steep rock scrambles. 


Duration:  3 hours  +/-    Finish about 1:30

Moderate Pace with some stops...depending on temps.  Not for HVH hardcorps, unless you are willing to poke along, carry my pack, and put up with my abuse.    But not for couch potatoes either.  

==============================================

The fine print...You must read:....!

You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. 


See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Official FPV Race Day! Come race for glory, (sometimes prizes) and podium rankings with New Jersey’s LARGEST FPV racing groups. If you're serious about FPV racing, this is an event you do not want to miss. We will be configuring a MultiGP Time Trial course for both racing and time recording.

If you do not have a Multi GP Pilot record yet, please create one and join our chapter :
http://www.multigp.com/chapters/view/Safety-Third-Racing-Team

Race events will be posted to multiGP later.  Secure your spot by RSVP Yes to this meetup.

NOTE:  We are racing two days in a row, SAT 19th and SUN 20th.

Location: </a><a href="https://goo.gl/maps/nxd8wESfFkk">https://goo.gl/maps/nxd8wESfFkk

ADDITIONAL LOCATION DETAILS:  The park is named Plainsboro Park. We will be meeting here: https://goo.gl/maps/xDjZiAxjc2R2. 

Feel free to park inside the apartment complex at 601 Fox Run Drive (https://goo.gl/maps/hArfhy9GZw82) or at the Plainsboro Park Parking Lot (https://goo.gl/maps/hEShCX6bFfT2)

Unofficial Team S3 time trial top speed:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zrILYcovINI

SIZE CLASSES:[masked]
BATTERY CLASSES: 3S and 4S races will be held 


Arrival Time: 10:30 AM, Free fly begins 11AM

 
Cost to fly None 


Note: As there is no power onsite, you'll need to bring enough charged batteries to race the entire day or invest in field charging gear. Ask some S3 Team Members for equipment advice. This is an open field - bring at least a chair. More info below.

Check-in: When you arrive, please check in with the Event Captain (typically Frank or Will) for safety, frequency allocations and course updates. 

 
Agenda: 


· Sign in/Registration/Pre-Free-Fly
· Free Fly Pilot Briefing/Walk the course
· Free Fly/Course Practice
· Solo / Special Announcements (Optional)
· Racing Pilot Briefing
· Heat Assignments
· Racing (3S, 4S, Finals)
· Balloon Chase/Streamer Chase ________________________________________________
First Timers: If this is your first time joining us, Welcome! Please take a few moments and read the notes below on our best practices for piloting, frequency and safety management. PLEASE CHECK IN WITH THE FLIGHT/SAFETY COORDINATOR before you fly or power up anything. First timers will be paired with an established S3 Team Pilot as your “Event Buddy”. You can observe firsthand S3 team pilots doing the following: flight preparation, pit adjustments, frequency compliance, field behavior and group signaling/announcing.
Got a non-racing, photography multirotor? It's always an awesome sight to see a large frame in the air capturing hi-res photography, so if you have one, please bring it. Please check in with Frank to make sure all video transmission is disabled. You will have to fly this line-of-site or run a 200mW VTX and adhere to frequency management to not interfere with the FPV racers.
Not flying? There's lot's of technical expertise, lurkers, newbies, and interested friends just hanging out, so even if you don't race, you can still fly, take videos, or just watch and learn. 

Meetup Location: Exact Address TBD


Look at google maps here for the exact location: 
</a><a href="https://goo.gl/maps/nxd8wESfFkk">https://goo.gl/maps/nxd8wESfFkk

Browse google maps ahead of time so you’re familiar with how to find us 


Please check in at the line of canopies at the end of the parking area and ask for Frank. 

 
Suggested equipment to bring:
Your aircraft(s), props and batteries, repair equipment
Something to sit on – this is an open field.
Something to sit under like a small (or large) canopy. Team members do bring canopies to manage their equipment and make repairs. We ask that everyone respects the space they need to operate comfortable.
AMA License: If you plan on flying, you can get it here: http://www.modelaircraft.org/).
Safety glasses or high impact sunglasses (for young pilots under 13 it is HIGHLY recommended)
Sunscreen and water. 

GENERAL HOUSEKEEPING:
NO FLY ZONE: For safety, the no fly zone is "IN, ABOVE AND BEHIND" the line formed by the pilot pit area. You may not operate your quad behind or to the right of the last canopy. When coming in for a landing, please approach slowly and don't prop wash/buzz everyone, there are lots of pilots "blind" with FPV goggles that can't tell if you are out of control or not. 


FLY ZONE: All pilots and spectators should stay out of the fly zone . Please pilot your aircraft from within the pit area (aka the no-fly-zone). If you crash or need to enter the field, please wait until races are over, and call out in the pit area your intentions so other pilots can avoid you. During free flight/ practice. you may enter the field by announcing “ON THE FIELD” loudly to entire pit area. 


CRASH & TRASH: Take out what you brought in, including a little extra while you're at it. That way we're always spotless and keep the park rangers happy. 

 
KIDS: we encourage bringing any family members and kids interested in RC flying, as it's a great place for young pilots to learn best practices in the art of FPV. For ground/flight safety purposes, we ask that all young pilots be always supervised and mentored on safe flying practices, kept away from dangerous fly zones, and be courteous/don't touch without asking in all staging areas. It is highly recommended for kids to wear protective eyewear. 

 
"ZERO HARM" RESPONSIBLE FLYING: Our group prides itself on minimal rules and attracts folks that are mindful, safety conscious oriented and considerate of other pilots, bystanders, pets, wildlife and the environment. IOW, if you are about to have a collision, especially with a dog, bird, human, or any living thing, think "zero harm" first and do everything you can to avoid the collision and immediately divert your flight path even if it means at the expense of your own rig. Living things are a lot harder to repair than metal and electronics and typically don't require litigation to fix. If in doubt please ask about best practices from any of the experienced pilots, we're all here to help learn and have a really great time together. 

 
RACING: Know your skill limits and pilot your quad accordingly. When flying, please be aware of other pilots calling out in the pit. Typically these are "Person on the course, dog on the course chasing rig, powering up on Vtx channel "X" , or the most critical, "WHOMEVER JUST POWERED UP, PLEASE POWER DOWN IMMEDIATELY!" and so on. It is critical you do not fly over people in the pit or other visitors in the park. But beyond this, most importantly, have a blast of fun! 

 
FREQUENCY MANAGEMENT
Since most pilots are using the 5.8ghz video transmitter bands for FPV video, so please be aware of your transmitter type (Fatshark/Immersion or Boscam) and frequency channel. Every pilot uses this technology to fly their aircraft safely, so it is imperative that every pilot understands and operates using safe video transmission practices. 

 
THE BASICS:
1) Never power up your video TRANSMITTER without first checking that there is no one else currently transmitting on the same channel. LOOK THROUGH YOU GOGGLES FIRST. Someone may accidentally be on the channel you were assigned. Listen intently when you do (even if you have a frequency tag), and if you hear a pilot exclaim that they've lost signal, power down immediately. Flying blind is a dangerous situation and is to be avoided at all costs.
2) Power up your video RECEIVER and goggles/display first BEFORE you power up your aircraft and video transmitter. If you see someone else's signal, then you need to switch your channel, you're stomping.
3) During races, only those in the race should be transmitting video .
4) For racing, the racing coordinator(s) will make frequency assignments and assign spotters.
5) Please arrange the video transmitter on your aircraft so that the dip switches/button to change your channels are easily accessible. You may need to change channels quickly just before your scheduled heat. 

 
Looking forward to seeing you there!

For we will do everything in our power to help you reach your goal. We operate in a judgement free zone to facilitate your comfort. We promise you will progress.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! This allows beginners or anyone with a minor injury to comfortable fit right in. Build your strength and endurance to perform the unmodified versions of the drill when you see FIT (pun intended :)!! All while moving to be beat of the music. Bring your family, bring your friends.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar Lessons II for Beginners - DECEMBER SESSIONS
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays in December. [Dec 5, 12, 19, and 26]


The December Series continues where we have left off at the end of November and is open only to the participants who completed the 4-week Series in November .  


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
In this workshop you will learn to READ NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

Monthly Four-Week Cycles
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

COST:  The cost of this session is $12.00, which must be paid when you RSVP.
results.name: Acoustic Guitar II for Beginners--December­

results.description:
Join us as we explore what was once the playgrounds of all things gang and mob related on this 2.5 hour walking tour. Stroll through historic downtown neighborhoods as you peer into their dark past. Visit famous sites of killings, movies, and infamous crimes.

Peer into New York's dark past and uncover hidden secrets when you visit places ruled by some of the city's most powerful gangs and mobs. Head to Little Italy, once the heart of a tight community of Italian immigrants, to hear stories about mob activities and visit notorious spots.

More info and tickets: https://goo.gl/TI9jJR

results.description:
We are having a work day on Saturday Dec. 19th. 11 AM to 3 PM.


This time would capture the available light such that it is and allow us to get some much needed work done in the garden.


Among the work we'd like to see done are the following tasks:


1. Relocate bales of straw from the front of Imani II to the rear of the garden. Many thanks to NYRP for donating these straw bales.2. Relocate the solar panel and batteries from the aquaponics system in Imani I to behind the greenhouse in Imani II. We did this last year as well. The solar panel and batteries can power our fan that moves hot air in the greenhouse during the day to warm the soil and water barrels, keeping the greenhouse warmer at night.3. Drain the water storage tanks.4. Hal Drellich has offered to prune the grape vines in Imani II. This might be a good opportunity for us to learn more about grape vine pruning.


I will make a soup and warm it on the fire pit in Imani I for those wanting some warming up or

weather permitting, provide all the fixins for pizza in our cob oven. Please bring your preferred pizza toppings, own beverage and work gloves. We have a limited number of work gloves available for those who don't have their own.

You can get to Imani II by taking the A/C or 3/4 trains to Utica Avenue. Walk toward Pacific Street then turn west. Imani is one block away at Schenectady Avenue.

A donation of $5 is requested to cover cost of food.
results.name: Work Day At Imani Garden

results.description:
7th Annual Holiday Party/Potluck/Molting & SOUL BABY Closing Party/Elevator Music 2 CD Release and Performance/Market on Market/Holiday Card Making Workshop/Affordable Art Fair

Wow! A day jam packed with activities, events, shopping, art, and food! Bring a tasty treat or yummy dish to share at the potluck and celebrate the closing of Gallery Aferro’s exciting exhibitions Molting and SOUL BABY. Make hand-made holiday cards with Patricia Davis, all materials provided by Gallery Aferro, just bring your imagination! It’s also the last Market on Market for 2015 so don’t miss it! Get your last minute holiday shopping in and support local artists, creators, and artisans. There will also be a curated grouping of performances for our Elevator Music installation running all day including artists Lydia Grey, Lorin Roser, Spencer Frohwirth, and Nicholas Sudol. Gallery Aferro’s annual holiday party is a local favorite and this year has more events than ever. Enjoy the holidays, arts, food, community and fun with us all day! More details coming!

11- 5 PM 40+ vendors at 85 Market St scenic Newark NJ. More specifically, 11-1 craft corner make your own cards, 1-2 crafter-led workshop to make your own ugly sweater cards. 3-5 free hot chocolate, yum. Violin music: intermittently. From 2-7 the 7th annual holiday potluck commences at 73 Market St scenic Newark NJ. More specifically, 2-5 Elevator Music Vol 2 Cd releases is celebrated with performance art and experimental music. 5ish some new a cappella songs. Time TBD: dance flashmob by Newark students. Is that enough to do on one day, or what? This event is like a turducken.

Market on Market offers handmade, upcycled, recycled and antique items as well as workshops and musical events. Over 40 vendors attend the market, and although some come back for each market, there is always a good rotation of new vendors each month. New vendors and arts programming scheduled during the event means each market is a unique and exciting experience so don’t miss it!

Your shopping supports Gallery Aferro and independent artisans, and your generous end–of-the-year fully tax deductible donation, if you are inclined, will help benefit the community arts program of Gallery Aferro, a 501 (c)3 nonprofit!
results.name: 7th Annual Holiday Party/Potluck/Molting Closing Party & Marketplace @ Aferro

results.description:
Truth/Truthfulness

“Truth means not just saying true things, but also being a true person.”  - Ven. Thanissaro Bhikkhu

So far in our examination of the perfections we’ve seen that we typically use external thoughts, ideas, people, and the environment as a reference points.  However, while that can give us good information, it is lacking the most important ingredient – what going on inside our hearts and minds? How does our heart move in response to each of these perfections as we navigate the experiences of life?

This inward focus is profoundly important as we now turn our attention to TRUTH and being truthful with ourselves. I’m sure you’ve heard the adage about love; “if you can’t love yourself, how are you going to love someone else?” It is the same with truth; if we’re not honest with ourselves, how can we begin to be truthful with others?

The Buddha taught us “to be true in whatever we do — to be true in being generous, true in being virtuous, true in developing concentration and discernment. Don’t play around at these things. If you’re true, then these activities are sure to bear you the fruits of your own truthfulness without a doubt.” [translation: Ven. Thanissaro Bhikkhu]

At the most basic level we all want more happiness and less suffering. But, because life includes suffering for everyone, we work in our practice to understand its causes and conditions. Being truthful with ourselves is where we begin and we ask one important question – “what am I doing that might be causing my suffering?” Through our practice and direct experience we investigate the truth we find and begin living from there. 

You can see that this investigation, wherever it takes us, is why the perfection of truth was considered the primary virtue by the Buddha. From this direct view we can be clear about our motives and intentions and be attentive to the skillfulness or unskillfulness of our actions. We can keep our commitment to the Five Precepts by abstaining from causing harm, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying and intoxication.

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us.

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

The Ten Perfections are important mind/body qualities or strengths that we can cultivate in any life situation and on the cushion.  When we make these Perfections our priority in life, they support us on our journey toward awake awareness.       The Ten Perfections or qualities of mind are:

Generosity (Giving)
Virtue (Morality/Ethics)
Renunciation (Letting go of obstacles to awakening)
Wisdom (Discernment)
Energy (Effort)
Patience (Endurance)
Truthfulness
Determination/Resolution
Loving Kindness/Goodwill
Equanimity (Impartiality and balance)
results.name: The Ten Perfections - Truthfulness

results.description:
Need to register at wyckoffanalytics.com to attend!

On December 19th, Golden Gate University Adjunct Professor Roman Bogomazov will present an all-day online workshop on Swing Trading with the Wyckoff Method. Though this approach works well on any time frame, it’s ideally suited to swing trading in harmony with market turns. This workshop, which is designed for intermediate to advanced traders, will emphasize trade durations of a few days to several months. During the workshop you’ll learn:

•How to scan for momentum swing trade candidates
•How to select the best trade candidates based on analysis of their:
- Market structure
- Supply and demand
- Relative and comparative strength
•Trade entry and management, including several Wyckoff exit strategies
•Intra-day entries to dramatically increase reward-to-risk ratios
•How to turbocharge your trades by synchronizing entries with market turns

Attendees at Roman’s prior swing trading workshop gave it rave reviews! Some comments:

"Brilliant analysis! Roman is terrific in explaining what the market is doing and where individual stocks are (probably) going.”

“Roman thinks out of the box…His explanations are clear and the information is so helpful. I believe in mastery…Roman’s analysis helps me so much on this path.”

When: Saturday, December 19, 2015, 8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m., including a break for lunch

Cost: $795

Discounted Registration: Before December 3rd

Previous Workshop Attendees - $450

Current AWTC, WTPC students and Annual Members - $595

Regular enrollment - $695
results.name: Holiday Special: Online Workshop on Swing Trading Using the Wyckoff Method

My apartment is in downtown Jersey City NJ. Easy to get to on the PATH, short walk from the Exchange Place station (if coming from World Trade Center) or Grove St station (if coming from midtown Manhattan.) No cost other than transportation, although we might chip in for food together.

It's an all day event, come and go anytime, we keep playing until midnight or so.   Feel free to bring video games to plug in too.

My cell phone if you need to contact or have any trouble finding the place: five five one - 9 9 8 - zero 6 one 6. Come have fun!

results.description:
CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES in Sara D. Roosevelt Park!

                                NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS

                           See our page on Facebook!:

       facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCuNsd9JXVE

Game description:

We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:


You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery

                                           New York, NY 10012

                                               (212)[masked]

                                          www.slaintenyc.com

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
First we'll visit the Jewish Museum (free), featuring legendary photographer Edward Steiglitz, Warhol's Liz and Marilyn, early Soviet photography and film (looks impressive), portrayal of Jews on TV, "unorthodox" art, and two other exhibitions, plus the permanent collection. Then we'll view the beautiful architecture of Carnegie Hill, in the east 80s and 90s. We'll warm up during lunch in the Met museum's cafeteria. (Bring your own lunch or buy it; pay what you wish to enter the museum.) After lunch we'll visit the fashion exhibition at the Met's costume institute ( internationally renowned style icon Countess Jacqueline de Ribes). Next we'll go to the nearby NYU Institute for the Study of the Ancient World (free), currently showing photography from the royal court of Persia in the late 1800s.  If time and daylight permit, we'll finish by walking a bit in Central Park.  


PLEASE READ THE DETAILS BELOW, SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 3 miles

PACE: MODERATE NOT SLOW. IF YOU WANT TO WALK SLOWLY, THIS IS NOT THE RIGHT EVENT FOR YOU. 

ENDING TIME: Around 4:30 PM (but you can leave earlier, of course). 

LUNCH: Bring it or buy it. We'll eat in the Met museum's cafeteria, starting around 2:30. You can bring your own food but please consider buying something, too, as a courtesy.


COST: pay what you wish to enter the Met (as little as $1), plus whatever you spend on lunch, plus $2 for me. The other two museums are free.  

TRANSPORTATION: 4 or 5 train to 86th St. or 6 train to 96th St. For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.
results.name: Three (almost) free museums, Carnegie Hill, & Central Park

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Ensemble class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Anyone and everyone is welcome!

(We prefer that you sign up online, so we can get an accurate head count. If you can only pay in-person, please bring exact change.)

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show called "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."

results.description:
RSVP's begin Thursday, December 17th at 1:00pm.  Approximately 4 miles of walking, level ground.  OPTIONAL SOCIAL HOUR FROM 4-5PM after the tour.

How did New York evolve from an obscure Dutch trading post in 1624 to the Capital of the World?  This guided walking tour is specially presented to group members who have attended two or less meetups in our group or are new to New York City (arriving 2015) and have not attended a prior Lower Manhattan meetup with us.  This 4-hour experience will cover Manhattan's history from the Dutch colonial period in the 1620's through the 1870's.  We'll cover the American Revolutionary time when New York was America's first Capitol, the origins of the stock market, the majestic buildings of the Civic Center area, newspaper row, Five Points and the Gangs of New York.  We'll also have a brief stroll through part of Chinatown and Little Italy, giving us an opportunity to talk about the city's rich immigrant history.  We will aim to end our walk in SOHO where we'll delight in its cast iron palaces and learn how the area has changed over time from residential, to industrial-commercial, to a haven for artists and now a shopping emporium.  

Note - As this will be 3-4 miles of walking I suggest bringing snacks to eat and water to drink. We can also make a stop at an excellent Chinese bakery for steamed or baked buns - with every kind of filling imaginable.  Please try and take care of business before the walk.  There are restrooms in the National Museum of the American Indian which opens at 10am (free admission).

Arrive early so you can enjoy a brief visit if you have never been there!  The interior is spectacular and one of our City's treasures!
