results.description:
This year to celebrate the Winter Solstice Reasonable New York has partnered with Raymond Arnold and his Brighter Than Today Secular Solstice event.

Reasonable New York will host a reception that will start at 5:30PM and continue until 10:30PM. Participants can hang out at the reception where we will have wine and snacks. Donations welcome to cover costs!

The Solstice singalong concert will take place in the auditorium. Tickets are $25 and are available at www.humanistculture.com  Tickets will also be available at the reception.

During the reception, members of Reasonable New York will be available to say hello and talk about their organizations. Spend some time with us, and I encourage you to attend the event upstairs as well. I have heard it was just great last year!

Once you have a ticket, feel free to go back and forth throughout the evening.

results.description:
This winter, Sunday Assembly will be co-sponsoring the Singalong Secular Solstice - a new, growing holiday. We'll be singing and celebrate how humanity transformed the season of darkness into a festival of light. 

The event will be held on Saturday, December 20th: two hours of music and ceremony that honors our humanity's past and celebrates our future. To pay for the venue and musicians, as well as recording the album, tickets are being sold for $25 at <a>www.humanistculture.com.</a> (If the price is a hardship, discount tickets are available - please send an email to [masked] and we'll work something out)


This year, the Reasonable New York Coalition will be holding their annual solstice celebration as a companion event - so the doors will be opening at 5:30 PM for celebration and festivities, and stay open until. Donations will be appreciated to cover food and drinks.

The musical ceremony will start approximately 6:30 and run till approximately 9:00. The closing reception will end at 10:30pm.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

results.description:
"I'd recommend this for all beginners and people looking to gain confidence in their skills. Simon has a great attitude, clear and informative way of communicating, and the class goes at a pace that was engaging and never dull." Lagina P.

Beginner's Drawing at The Metropolitan Museum of Art

* This Meetup is structured as a drawing class. It is limited to 7 students. 

This class is for you if you are relatively new to drawing and want direction on how to proceed. This class is for beginners and for people who consider themselves beginners.

Each student receives personal instruction and technical advice based on their drawings during the session. 

The Class:

1) We begin with a short lecture in The American Wing.  We discuss the different pencils and paper as well as system of drawing simple forms to represent the 3 Dimensional world. 

2) Together we head into the galleries to work on our first drawing exercise. I will sit with each student to discuss their work and make sure the lesson is understood and effective.

3) We meet briefly to discuss our work, ask any questions and get our next exercise. 

4) We set out to draw again. And again I visit with each student to talk about their work. 

5) Finally we meet to discuss what we have learned and answer any final questions. 

Material Requirements: Students should bring a drawing pad, a 2H pencil, a HB pencil, a 4B pencil, an eraser and a pencil sharpener. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 

Simon

_______________________________________________

Please note: this event is not affiliated with The Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Museum admission is not included in the event cost. Museum tickets are suggested only and you may pay as much as little as you wish.
results.how_to_find_us: The American Wing - Gallery 700 - We meet at the fountain.
results.name: Beginner: Drawing at The Metropolitan Museum of Art

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This group meets on the second Saturday of each month and spotlights guest speakers from SF and genre related fields of interest.

Join us for our annual Holiday Dinner/Guest event.  We are pleased to announce special guest Matt Manochio.  Mr. Manochio is the author of The Dark Servant ( Samhain Publishing).  Dark Servant is about Krampus -- Saint Nicholas's dark companion -- perfect for the Christmas season. In European folklore, Saint Nick (yes, our Santa Claus) rewards the good kids. Krampus, a hairy, horned devil, snatches bad children on December 5 - Krampusnacht, the Night of Krampus - and takes them away to his lair to punish them. Mr. Manochio sets his Krampus loose in northern NJ!  Hope you've been good!

We'll begin the evening with food & festvities at 6:00pm.  Mr. Manochio will take the stage at 7:30/8:00pm.  Following Mr. Manochio's presentation, we'll break for coffee/dessert.  Mr. Manochio will resume with a Q&A and book signing.

results.description:
Union Square Speak-Out in NYC  is something that I miss. It gave people the opportunity to vent but also share knowledge that, even to this day,  is hard to find online.

So, with the help of WRASK Inc, (www.wrask.com) we are bringing the Speak-Out back to NYC.  

What is a Speak-Out. The 14th Street Speak-Out resembles an ordinary open mic. It will encourage us to share our expressions (thoughts, poems, lessons learned and experiences) that we need to get out.  It could be personal experiences that's beneficial to other and many times it's things going on in the community that isn't getting media attention we needs to be known. 

The biggest difference with a speak out and especially with our speak-out is that we want to build a community; a movement that will encourage each other with empathy and promote positive progression through sharing knowledge.

The event will also be streamed live at http://www.wrask.com 

Come out and share! 

Your experiences and expressions matter!

*If you have any questions, please leave a comment.
results.name: Speak-Out And Share Our Thoughts

results.description:
Everything is prepared for a wonderful Holiday Táncház!

László Orbán will play with our musicians -- Laci is an experienced performer from Transylvania who spent much time with the Hungarian State Folk Ensemble.

Because of your participation and kind donation, we have been able to have Laci come and keep our admissions price to $15 ($10 students)!  Our guest teachers from Hungary, Lilla Zsuráfszky and Gábor Tapolczai, will be with us as well. 

The Dance Workshop at 7:00 pm will be on dances of the Gyimesi Csángó people, our Hungarian neighbors way to the East of Transylvania in Romania.  Come hear this haunting music and the beat of the ütőgardon!

The táncház is open to all levels of dancers / beginners welcome / We will have teaching circles for all the dances, so you can always jump in!  Or watch, have some refreshments, and eat our tasty food!  Or check out the Hungarian bazaar!

See you soon!

Here is exactly what to expect:

- Private event at the World Bar for CRC members and friends 7pm-midnight

-Cocktails and socializing with passed and plated Hors Dourves 7pm-9pm.

-Christmas Music 7pm-8pm followed by a live DJ spinning great party tunes played at reasonable levels.

-Expect[masked] attendees ages 20's-50's.  The room hold 160 and has 2 levels to socialize, mix, mingle and connect. You will find plenty of people in your demographic group to chat with!

Can I come alone?  Yes, many people will come on their own.  We will have council members at the event to make sure that anyone who is new to the group feels welcomed and is introduced to others.

Will there be dancing? There is no formal dance floor but based on the people we have in the group there is sure to be dancing. 


Should I eat beforehand?  Yes.  There will be plenty of appetizers at the party but you may wish to have something more substantial.

What is the cost? $25 per person. Proceeds benefit the San Pedro Catholic Mission

How do I pay? Pay at the door


How do I get there? Check www.mta.info for weekend service changes for buses and subways.  The World Bar is located on the corner of 1st avenue and east 48th

Non refundable

results.description:
On December 19th Raymond Arnold invites the New York Mythological Roundtable to a Secular Solstice event. A two-hour event of storytelling and music, as we tell the story of humanity, and how we have faced the darkness together over the ages. Experience an emerging mythology told in today's language and understanding.

Raymond describes the event:

"Long ago, winter was a challenging time. The world grew dark and cold. Plants withered and game became scarce. It was a mysterious problem.

People celebrated in the face of that adversity. Partly to raise their spirits and carry forward as a community, and partly as a way to try to affect the world around them. Their best understanding - their mythology - was that divine forces controlled the world. Perhaps those forces could be bartered or reasoned with.

Today, our mythology has changed. Our best understanding is that the light comes and goes because of astronomical events. Meanwhile, there are challenging mysteries we don't yet know the answer to, such as how to resolve poverty, disease and conflict."

The Secular Solstice tells the story of how our understanding has changed over the millennia, and how we have worked to light the darkness together.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Doors open at 5:30pm for an opening reception, with the program officially starting at 6:30pm. Tickets are available at www.humanistculture.com. (They're $25, but if that's a hardship for anyone they can send me an email at [masked] and I'll add them to the guestlist).

results.description:
Our 3rd Democratic Debate takes place a few days before the holidays and hopefully all those Bernie Sanders supporters, from out of town, will stay in New York on Saturday, Dec. 19 to be part of the crowd watching our candidate speaking to the American people via ABC.

We are meeting again at the same cozy place in the neighborhood to watch the debate, eat and drink together and to root for Bernie Sanders, the leader of our political revolution... the guy who will take the White House by storm with the power of the people after winning the Democratic Party nomination.

Nothing will stop us... The DNC set up this date hoping people will be too busy shopping on the Saturday before the holidays, yet we are going to stop everything and join together to watch Bernie performing better than ever, speaking from his heart and with the honesty he has carried during the 30 years of his political career.

New converts are welcome! And anybody who wants to Feel the Bern!!

results.description:
Dear ACMA Fans,
On Saturday night, December 19th, 2015 at 7:30 p.m., ACMA will take the stage for our "Passion Through Performance" Concert (Zankel Hall at Carnegie Hall). Once more, we will proudly display our talent on one of the world's most famous performance venues. Please join us!

Passion Through Performance Program


1. Arabesque No. 1 (C. Debussy): Lois Ross (Piano)


2. Arpeggione Sonata in E minor, D.821, Allegro moderato (F. Schubert): Christopher James (Cello), David James (Piano)


3. Gestillte Sehnsucht, Geistliches Wiegenlied (J. Brahms): Yaffa Borukhova (Mezzo-Soprano), Kiersten Cooke (Viola), Neil Prufer (Piano)


4. Grande Valsa de Bravura (C. Gomes): Stephanie Ching (Piano)


5. Palisades Suite:Of Sadness, Of Beauty (E. Ewazen): Danielle Errico (Piano), Magee Hickey (Flute), Sarah Monte (Clarinet)


6. Concerto Grosso Op. 6, No. 8 in G Minor: III. Adago (A. Corelli), Ave Maria (G. Caccini- Arr. M. Zephyrine), March and Battle (from Rinaldo, Act III- G.F. Handel): Renee Ogiste (Tenor Pan), Christopher Chasteau (Double Guitar Pan), Akeel Daniel (Tenor Pan), Andy Dauxy (Six Bass Pan), Furness Norton (Double Tenor Pan), Nyana Price (Double Seconds Pan), Michael Zephyrine (Continuo/Voice)


7. Serenata Espanola (J. Malats), Julia Florida (A. Barrios-Mangore), Music for a Found Harmonium (S. Jeffes): Anthony Purdy (Guitar)


8. La Rosa y el Sauce, Trigo (Carlos Guastavino), The Prayer (D. Foster, C. B. Sager, A. Testa, T. Renis): Ariel Maida (Tenor), Matias Rivero (Counter Tenor), Peter Laurens (Piano)


9. Concerto for Classical Guitar and Jazz Piano: Africaine (C. Bolling): Anthony Purdy (Guitar), Daniel Wolf Savin (Bass), Julian McCarthy (Drums), Liza Wu (Piano)


10. Erklonig (F. Schubert): Simon Yau (Piano)


11. The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting on an Open Fire) (M. Torme): Clarisse Valbon (Violin), Bob Wei (Violin 1), Melania Valverde (Violin), Christopher James (Cello), Eduardo Tenenbaum (Cello), Daniel Wolf Savin (Bass), Julian McCarthy (Drums), Alberto De Salas (Piano)


All seats are $30.00. If you'd like to purchase tickets, please visit the Carnegie Hall website at: http://www.carnegiehall.org/Calendar/2015/12/19/0730/PM/Passion-Through-Performance-Amateur-Musician-Showcase/.

Please support ACMA and join us for an unforgettable evening of artistry and excellence. See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.carnegiehall.org/Information/Directions/
results.name: ACMA Concert at Carnegie Hall

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 28-38 - 3f/1m spots left

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC - Singles 25-55

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.  

At present we need both men and women (aged 32 to 44) although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.

Grab friends and come along to The Wheeltapper Pub to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance. Also tickets are free for a limited time.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me

(i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel

results.description:
Konnichiwa,

I hope everyone is enjoying this warm winter. 


We are having a ”忘年会（Bounenkai)" on Saturday, December 19th at 7:30 pm.

This will be the last J-Meetup event this year, and also unfortunately my last J-Meetup event as the organizer. Due to my career advancement, I have more responsibilities and studies to manage, therefore, I have decided to step down from the organizer position in the end of 2015.


We are seeking my successor to organize the J-Meetup starting January 2016. If you are interested, please send me an e mail.

Thank you all for participating in the J-Meetup events in the last 11 years, and I hope everyone will continue developing his/her Japanese / English language skills. 


Yoijoho

results.description:
From their website: Opened in fall of 2012, Petit Poulet is a French Bistro & Wine Bar located near Herald Square. Petit Poulet’s charming and intimate setting features warm wood walls, mosaic tile floors, and a classic tin ceiling in an ode to classic parisian bistros.


Located in the Radisson Hotel in Herald Square, Petit Poulet offers lunch and dinner menus, appealing to both travelers and locals alike. Some examples of the customary French fare includes French Onion Soup, Beef Tartar, Escargot, various tartine dishes, and rotisserie Cornish hen.

Seating options include tables, booths, and bar seats. Additionally, for a few lucky diners, we offer special bar style seating in front of our open kitchen, giving them a unique view of our talented chefs creating meals from scratch.

Yelp page: http://www.yelp.com/biz/petit-poulet-new-york

The reservation is under the name Angela. Cash is easier to deal with just in case the restaurant is picky about how many credit cards can be used, thus please bring cash if you can. A $3.00 meet up fee will be added to your bill. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

results.description:
Sue Gola will call a lively program of contras accompanied by John Coté, of the former Perpetual E-motion, and Audrey Knuth, from the Free Raisins!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Sue Gola, John Coté, and Audrey Knuth!

results.description:
Watch the debates with us!

Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is preparing to create theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. There might be multiple Hillarys, a female Bernie, a Greek chorus of "questions from Facebook"--anything to illustrate and illuminate the candidates. First theater performance is in January, but join us for the first step in making it: a Watch Party!

Debate starts at 8pm but please arrive early! And tip your bartender!!

Learn more about the theater project: http://www.theaterinasylum.com/debates.html

results.description:
Turns out Karl's Klipper has room, so we are back to our usual meeting spot!

Our ordinary meeting order of business will be condensed and shortened, some things possibly left as unfinished business for the next meeting, in order to focus on the presidential primary debate.

Our biweekly meeting of the official Staten Island chapter of Progressive Democrats of America.


Order of Business:


1) With surge in new membership, once again go over our core strategies, vision, and mission.


2) Reach a settled agreement on a new logo for this chapter. I have received official materials from national which should at least partially influence our final logo design.


3) Discuss proposed outreach strategies. In particular putting into action Outreach Coordinator Russ's proposal for outreach at the ferry terminal.

4) Reports from other leadership Coordinators on their activities and progress

5) Discuss formulating an official newsletter, including graphic design. Report on both club activities and also invite members to contribute opinion pieces.


Anything else is TBD!

Following the meeting we shall have a debate viewing party for the third Democratic presidential primary debate for the debate which begins at 8PM Eastern Time!

Please share your thoughts on which topics you would like to place on the agenda via any of the following:

A) On the MeetUp forums: http://www.meetup.com/THESIPDA/messages/boards/

B) On the Facebook group discussion page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1021523487860937/


C) Our group e-mail correspondence chain. If you are not on our e-mail list and wish to be placed on it, please do let me know.

Thanks, hope to see you there.
results.name: SIPDA Meeting/Debate Viewing Party

results.description:
Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating. We expect 12 men and 12 women and the next day, we will inform you of any matches (the people you picked who also picked you). 

How does it work?


You will go on about 12 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 23-38, Women 21-35

Tickets are $25 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.

PS: We are promoting this event on several Single professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone.

Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music (Hustle Room/WCSwing Room & Mixed Ballroom/Latin Room), great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson with Mixed Social Dancing in an adjacent room. Then the DJ's take over at 9p and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

results.description:
The holiday season is upon us and what better way to celebrate with friends and family than by joining Edible History’s Medieval table for a Tudor Feast! Step back in time to the reign of famed Tudor monarchs like Henry VIII, Bloody Mary and Elizabeth I, as England broke away from the Roman Catholic Church,Shakespeare composed his sonnets, and explorers like Sir Walter Raleigh began the conquest of the New World. 

Diners can expect dazzling dishes from the tables of Hampton Court like Cockentrice, a stuffed suckling pig joined with a roast turkey to represent a mythical beast. Also on the menu, traditional mince meat pie and wine poached pears with spices sourced from the depths of the enchanted East. Expect stories of court life, love and execution, tales of Elizabethan London, what it was really like to work in a Medieval kitchen. 

Dinner to take place at Café Ghia in Bushwick, Brooklyn on December 19th, 2015 at 8pm. 

Tickets are $120 per head, wine included, and are available for purchase with link below:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-tudor-feast-tickets-19661766874

Edible History is a historical dining collective. We are a supper club, test kitchen, and research lab combined. It is our mission to bring the past to life through food, drink, and story. 


Each of our menus focuses on a specific time or place, realized through recipes and menus of the era, themes of daily life, and tales of the people who lived them. We utilize seasonal ingredients and unique spaces to ground our dinners in the present. Join our table for a most delectable and illuminating dining experience, unlike any other.
results.name: Edible History Tudor Feast

Join us for our annual multi-Meetup Holiday Party @ Croton!

• Live DJ & Dancing


• Prizes for UGLIEST Holiday Sweaters

Tickets -

1st 20 tickets are available for just $10 at -

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/jingle13/dates/Dec-19-2015_at_0900PM

$15 after that online, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o

Is this event private?  The entire venue will be 100% private for our party.  Members can invite guests to join us.  

What's dress code? No sweats, hats, etc Jeans ok. Dress stylish. 


Can I come alone?  Most come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event is not age or ethnic specific. We will have a wide mix of ages (21-50s). 


Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 200+ members attending

results.description:
Scythian is a Celtic/Celtic rock band based in the DC Metro Area, celebrating over 10 years together. The band's sound encompasses everything from traditional jigs to a mix of Celtic, Klezmer, Gaelic, Gypsy and Rock.

Scythian on youtube: www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q5QVxsBHubU

Named after Ukrainian nomads, Scythian plays immigrant rock with thunderous energy, technical prowess, and storytelling songwriting, beckoning crowds into a barn-dance rock concert experience. Nashville's Music City Roots says Scythian is "what happens when rock star charisma meets Celtic dervish fiddling"

Band consists of the Brothers Fedoryka, Danny &  Alex & their sister, Larissa, together with Josef Crosby & Tim Hepburn. 

In this their annual Christmas show, SCYTHIAN hosts a contest with a $100 Prize for the wearer of the ugliest Christmas sweater!    Come join the fun,  get your sweater out of mothballs, and compete to win $100 smackeroos.

• Admission for this fantastic band is only a $10.00 Cover Charge payable at the door on the night of the concert.  No tickets needed. STOUT does not take reservations either.  

For more info on this fabulous band's career visit their website:  scythianmusic.com

PLEASE NOTE A NEW PERFORMANCE TIME OF 10:00 PM NOT 8 AS PREVIOUSLY STATED.   

THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT THE ADMISSION PRICE AT THE

DOOR IS ONLY $10 NOT $20.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the fans in Ugly sweaters!
results.name: SCYTHIAN ANNUAL UGLY CHRISTMAS SWEATER CONCERT

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for our Saturday Night Social Mixer@ Slate NYC. We always have a fun time at that venue.

The group will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from our other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Dive Dry DivingWarm and Comfortable. Come to the pool and Give it a try. 


SAVE UP TO $800

You get to experience the comfort of drysuit diving in a fun and informative setting with our Dive Professionals. Come prepared with your SCUBA certification card, swimsuit or light clothing beneath the undergarment (No Denim). Bring your regular dive equipment (regulator, BCD, mask, snorkel, open heel fins, weights (plus a little extra), cylinder) and a small towel, or for just $10 use ours. After you go through a short briefing, we'll fit you with everything you need to dive dry, warm and comfortable. You'll go in the water with a dive leader (no need to be drysuit certified) who will show you the basics on how to use a drysuit. Isn't it funny how hungry we are at the end of a dive. We'll have snacks for every diver.

$10 If you need rental gear Pay Now!


$5 for Air Cylinder Pay Now

Premium members FREE

Become A Premium Member

No other entrance fees

We're making Diving dry Affordable

results.name: Test Dive a Drysuit at the Pool

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Excellent games last week. Thank you all for coming and showing up early. We were able to get the teams set up early and each team played three games. While there was a blow out game, most were competitive.

After all the hoopla, here are the results for the starting QB's:

Mo had a 2-0 record, Abe was 2-1, Eric had 1 win and half a loss, Mike D had no wins and 1.5 loss (could've easily been 1-0.5 had his receiver catch that wide open TD), O'Neil was 1-2 (despite having the strongest team of receivers), and Yury was 0-1. Mo was the MVP this week with his solid play. Eric won his lone game by attrition and is looking forward to this coming week for redemption after a plethora of interceptions.

Some receivers played well, others less so but the teams that won did so as a team. We'll continue the same set-up as last week so please show up on time!!!!

Questions or problems then give me a call at[masked] but I usually won't be answering as I'll be setting up the field or playing... 

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned, permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

results.description:
We did this as an after-work event in the summer with my hiking  group and it was a blast! So, I am thinking of doing it again for those who missed it last time. Click to see pictures from that event.

Let's meet at the Tram Plaza on 60 Street and 2nd Ave at 9 AM and take the tram over to Roosevelt Island. 


Roosevelt Island Tram

Once we reach the island, we'll explore. On our "urban hike," we'll take in  Manhattan views, visit the Southpoint Park, Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park, Northpoint Lighthouse, and Octagon before taking 36 Ave Pedestrian Bridge to Long Island City / Astoria. 

Southpoint Park

Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park 

Northpoint Lighthouse

Here we will walk on Vernon Boulevard and visit two additional parks in Astoria: Rainey Park and Socrates Sculpture Park. 

Rainey Park - Within view are the Queensboro Bridge, Roosevelt Island Bridge, Triboro, Hellsgate, and a small pedestrian bridge going from Manhattan to Wards Island. 

Socrates Sculpture Park

Our final destination will be an ethnic restaurant in Astoria. There is a wide array to choose from: Thai, Indian, Brazilian, Italian, Bengali, French - you name it :-)). 

Nearby subways in Astoria are N, Q, R, M trains. 

I'm looking forward to seeing everyone!
results.name: Manhattan to Roosevelt Island to Astoria + Lunch / Drinks

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Join us for our tenth annual Holiday NY City Hike!! This is always a really fun time and one of the best attended hikes we schedule every year! This year, we'll take a sort of similar route but cover almost entirely new stuff.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xat1/v/t1.0-9/12006341_949073478462524_7203134032848761160_n.jpg?oh=2770297b2b0b6a80198d6a0e9d9f39da&oe=56A922BF

This year, we begin of course at NY Penn Station as we have so many years past. We will meet at the big Christmas Tree which is in the large circular mall type area of the station. If you exit the train area, go up steps and turn right through a long corridor with a rounded roof, it takes you to the mall section. Ask anyone where the tree is and they can tell you. Last year it was slightly off to the side instead of in the center.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfl1/v/t1.0-9/11954698_948455335191005_6116127469119316456_n.jpg?oh=3fa90cdb9e29699b251d43f13d182d36&oe=568C0FF7

I will be taking a train in either from Summit or a station slightly further to the east. If you'd like to coordinate train with me, let me know. I will be posting details as to my personal plans as the time nears.
Train is scheduled to arrive from Summit NJ in Manhattan at 9:42.

We'll walk north from there on street, probably following a little bit of Broadway and walking by the Macy's displays. We will continue on street until we get to Central Park.
I CANNOT KEEP TRACK OF EVERYONE! With over seventy participants typically attending this hike, it's just too hard to stay together, so head toward Central Park if you get lost.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xat1/v/t1.0-9/11921659_946728562030349_5336410204643331644_n.jpg?oh=2ea9237fb1c5e064a0008c275a1c7ee3&oe=569B329F

This year, I plan to head more up through the center of Central Park, as we've followed both the east and west sides on past hikes, and we've also taken the Old Croton Aqueduct route through. We are always trying to do something different, so we'll weave around a bit, but we will reach the northern end of Central Park.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlf1/v/l/t1.0-9/11988568_948071781896027_6453821598854925390_n.jpg?oh=17bb8e6e8e3ef46a3b6163826ea09c50&oe=56973EE8

From here, we head a couple of blocks to the south side of Morningside Park, another linear park we have never walked through on these hikes. We'll follow the entire length of it.

We head north to 123rd Street, turn right, then left on well named St. Nicholas Ave to St. Nicholas Park, yet another linear park we have not walked through yet. It seemed appropriate this year for this hike to head through St. Nicholas Park!

We will exit the park at 141st St, take Edgecombe Ave four blocks north and enter the next linear park, Jackie Robinson Park. We will follow this park too, to the north side.

One block west from the north end of this park is the start of  High Bridge Park, heading to one of the main things I hope to showcase with this hike: The High Bridge.
The High Bridge was once the Old Croton Aqueduct's way across the East River, constructed in the 1840s to bring fresh drinking water to NYC.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfp1/v/t1.0-9/10382435_290860391093495_7129352935928121336_n.jpg?oh=7ce990f5d8f01f6d5397c25c194f285b&oe=56A8E307

The High Bridge was just opened to pedestrian traffic for the first time in over forty years, and remains one of the only pieces of the Old Croton Aqueduct we have not had the pleasure of hiking.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/416942_10150578527811777_1433336349_n.jpg?oh=07d25d2d894b5188972c561eac998de2&oe=56984A3D

We'll head to the other side, and then probably take to the waterfront depending on the time remaining. We will be open to suggestions at that time because we'll have achieved the goal of getting across the bridge. If something goes wrong from that point, our route will instead be a waterfront walk continuing in Manhattan.
Everyone should have my cell number ready:[masked]
The hike is rain or shine, so everyone should bring weather appropriate clothing.

USE RESTROOMS BEFORE YOU ARRIVE! Be aware of the route and utilize restrooms quickly when we have them. We will not be waiting an hour for everyone to use restrooms. We'll take breaks along the way to use convenient ones, but everyone should be prepared and have an idea of where we are going.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the large Christmas Tree inside Penn Station, located in a big concourse with stores, a mall type area. Walk out of the train area and turn right down a long hall. You'll get there.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This series will explore a sacred text first developed in 5th century India known as the Lam Rim, or Gradual Path. During these sessions we will investigate a system of reflection on contemplative life and human development. Primary tools of meditation-based change, discursive learning, analytic reflection and focused contemplation will be examined as means to cultivate reliable states of compassion and equanimity, and to radically reduce suffering associated with anxiety and depression. Together we will learn about the relevance of this ancient spiritual text for addressing contemporary forms of stress and discontent while increasing our general well-being.

Dr. Pilar Jennings, a long- time practitioner of Tibetan and Vipassana Buddhism, is also a psychoanalyst who incorporates Buddhist teaching in her clinical practice. She earned a doctorate in Psychiatry and Religion from Union Theological Seminary and currently teaches courses though the Center for the Study of Science and Religion at Columbia University. She is also the author of Mixing Minds: The Power of Relationship in Psychoanalysis and Buddhism.

Trail Details: The Brooklyn Trail Runners team up with the always gracious and wonderful NewRo Runners to run the Paine to Pain trail half marathon course. The trail head is less then a half mile from the station. There is a water stop and bathroom at mile 2.5. This a mild trail run. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about running trails and having fun!


When:  10:18 am.

Via public transit: Take the 9:36 am Metro North (New Haven Line) train from Grand Central to Mamaroneck. Train arrives at 10:18 am. Travel time 42 minutes.

If you are driving: Put 1 Station Plaza, Mamaroneck, NY 10543 in your GPS.

Bag Drop/Etc: There is always a bush or a pile of leaves to stash your stuff in, just make sure everything important is on you while you run. Sometimes BTR members who own cars show up at this location.
