results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME TO FALL YOGA! 

As Summer officially draws to an end, we look forward to a process of  reaping the harvest and letting go.  Fall is a time of transition and it is evident everywhere around us.  After the glorious celebration of summer, the trees and shrubs are undressing in preparation for the winter, the air is crisping, and the wind is whispering coming of the winter tides.  Although this may leave us feeling slightly down, the possibility to strip down to a quiet essence of being and and savor the simplicity is an opportunity for introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a practice to balance the Vata dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself this season....  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Get in the festive swing with our last pickup of the year.


Teams are 7v7, 75min+ game. New turf at the majestic Grand St Field!


Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun!

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward field permits, equipment, fees and any light rentals.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

Okay Super easy to find this parking lot

Take 23 North straight to High Point The parking lot will be on your left . It will say Appalachian trail parking lot. 

[masked]°N /[masked]°W
Mark's cell[masked] AUTHOR'S NOTE: THIS ROUTE SHOULD NOT BE CONFUSED WITH THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL APPROACH FROM THE SOUTH THAT BEGINS ON ROUTE 23 NEAR THE ENTRANCE TO HIGH POINT STATE PARK.
From NY: Take I-84 Exit 2 and proceed south on County Route 55 (AKA Mountain Road). This road crosses into New Jersey approximately 3.3 miles from the Interstate and becomes Route 519 but keeps the Mountain Road moniker. The Appalachian Trail crosses the road approximately 2/10 of a mile into New Jersey. Park on the shoulder of the road.
From NJ: The State Route 23/County Route 519 split is located approximately 1 mile southeast of the entrance to High Point State Park. From this point, follow Mountain Road (County Route 519) north for 2.3 miles to the Appalachian Trail crossing. Park on the shoulder of the road.

results.description: Join us for our annual intergenerational Winter Solstice celebration! We will gather to share warmth, music and delicious food and drink as we acknowledge the short days and long nights ahead. Winter Solstice is a time of energy and renewal where communities come together to brave the darkness and enter into a new period of health and peace. For our gathering this year, we will focus what each of us can bring to the places in our lives, and in the larger world, that could use some light right now. We’ll also sing, light candles and cheer on our littlest participants as they raise the sun!
results.name: Sunday Platform: Winter Solstice Celebration

Calling all camera, lighting, sound, editors, and of course, talent! I've had this idea for quite some time, and now I'm going to shoot it.

results.description:
The foundational argument of liberation theology is that God’s allegiance is to the oppressed and disinherited of every community. The very notion of God—whether in biblical theology or in radical social politics—is conceived as a politically mindful and active being who lends support and active resistance against all dehumanizing forces. But what material proof do the oppressed have of such a politically conscious force? Perhaps traditional notions of God as “good,” as “moral,” as “loving” are actually only human attributes projected onto God with no evidence that these qualities can be traced to a divine activity actually present in the world. These sessions will present some of the foundational work in black liberation theology of Professor James Cone in the context of the critique of the philosopher William R. Jones. In what sense is it possible to speak meaningfully of God as moral or good or liberating?

Jamall Andrew Calloway is a doctoral candidate in theology at Union Theological Seminary with a principal focus on black liberation theology. A native of Oakland, California, Jamall graduated summa cum laude with a BA from Tougaloo College in Jackson, Mississippi, where he wrote a thesis on W.E.B. DuBois. In 2013 he earned a Master of Divinity degree from the Yale Divinity School and has served for the past three summers as minister of the Congregational Church in Mount Washington, Massachusetts.


FYI, speaker is very good and we had a very interesting Q&A after the first talk. Highly recommend!

results.name: God of the Oppressed: Black Liberation Theology

results.description:
Adorama's Post- Seminar: 12 Things to Have in your Bag

The holidays are upon us!!! With the holidays come tasty treats, big celebrations and gifts. As photographers, there are always an endless variety of accessories that we want or need and the only thing more frustrating than not having them is picking the wrong one. In anticipation of the season of giving, Brooklyn Born (a.k.a. Al) will be going over 12 items that photographers should have in their camera bags.  These items are beneficial with features that can be very handy when you need them. You do not need to bring your camera gear to this workshop, but definitely bring a notepad and a pen.  He will answer questions at the end of the seminar. 

The good people at Adorama will be hosting us again so we can all stay warm and toasty indoors. As a a great little gift, we'll be raffling off an Adorama Gift Card to one lucky attendee!! Hope to see you there!!!

UPDATE: We will have a second raffle for this MeetUp! The folks over at YourArtGallery.com will be giving away a  1-year Platinum Membership. If you were at the last MeetUp, you know that this website helps photographers display and sell their work, while giving the photographer the vast majority of the selling price!

------------------------------------------------------------------

• As always, please be on time. Allow yourself enough travel time and check the MTA for any subway updates. We won’t be able to take calls and answer messages after the meetup starts.

• Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, please post them on this event page.

------------------------------------------------------------------


Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Taylor Pearson started hosting a Sunday brunch in San Diego in early 2014 after he heard an interview from a writer that it was the best thing he'd done for his social life while trying to write full time. 

Having a regularly scheduled meeting with friends let him make sure he was keeping in touch with people he cared about and still be able to spend most of the week in his writing cave.

It's since become one of Taylor's favorite things and he puts together a brunch with cool peeps every Sunday regardless of where in the world he is. 

It always gives him something to look forward to every week and keeps him from feeling guilty if he sits in his cave and work all week :).

Hope you'll join and feel free to bring friends - the more the merrier!

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Ravagh Persian Grill Persian/Iranian - East Village 

125 First Avenue, New York, New York

2 spots still open!!!

Lamb Shank and Dill Basmati Rice 

</a><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ravagh-persian-grill-new-york-6">See all 21 photos

We will share a variety of dishes which I will order and share Bill + T&T+$2 MU Fee. Please be responsible. If you do not show you cannot attend any of my events again. Limit 8 People.    Sarina

“Shish beef kebab was outstanding and the lamb shank was very good too.” 

$16 Lamb Shank

“so we opted for medium, which I believe was the proper choice, because the barg came out incredibly tender and full of flavor.”  We ordered a few dishes to share, some appetizers and hummus, along with Turkish coffee.  The hummus is the best I have ever had, I mean lick the plate clean good.  The stuffed pepper with lamb was so delicious and the bread was literally cooked to order and so delicious. 

For the appetizer, we ordered the humus and babaganoosh.  Both tasted good and the texture was perfect to eat with the pita bread that they served.  However, both could've used more seasoning.  The babaganoosh also had this very strong smoky or grilled taste to it.  I also tried a bit of my friend's traditional kashk-bademjan.  I would definitely opt for this as the appetizer next time instead.  It was much more flavorful and mouth-licking. For the entree, I ordered Lamb Chops Kebab.  Portion size was pretty large.  The lamb chops were a bit overcooked were medium rare.  However, the meat was still tender and juicy.  I opted for the grilled vegetables instead of the basmati rice.  And boy, I am glad I did.  All of my other friends were having trouble finishing cause they had so much to eat.  Nonetheless, the vegetables were all perfectly grilled.  They were soft, juicy, and had the natural sweetness and taste of the veggies..

Lamb chops kebob

We started with the traditional kashk bademjan, an eggplant spread served with naan. The same flavor as my old go-to but a slightly different texture; either way, delicious and no complaints! Next up: beef barg and koobideh. We were asked how we wanted it cooked - never been asked before, so we asked what they recommended. Their suggestion of medium well seemed... too cooked? so we opted for medium, which I believe was the proper choice, because the barg came out incredibly tender and full of flavor. The saffron rice comes with tomato and onion for you to use as you please (I suggest mixing the tomato in the rice). There's a healthy serving of rice, and it's light and fluffy, and not very oily (both a good and bad thing - I appreciate the less oil from a health perspective; my friend would've liked a bit more oil in it). Oh - back to the barg - full of flavor, tender, mostly cut for easy eating, definitely a must-try. A++. The koobideh was good, but not the best I've ever had, though my friend and I couldn't place why - it had good flavor, it was tender, but.. There's some improvement that could have been made to make it perfect, I just can't place it, and as it was, it was still very delicious and something I would order again - but definitely medium, not medium well.

Aside from that, the staff is very polite and attentive. Authentic place, cute on the inside with enough seating to not feel cramped but also feel cozy. A must-try.

Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
Lets take a December stroll through central park in this unusual weather.

Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirit.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

New members let’s meet :)

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations: 
In order to assure effective discourse space is very limited. Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
Participation is FREE.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.

results.description:
Admission: $25 per session Guest fee (free for NYSEC members)

http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/blindspot.png?itok=MAnMCtu1 Workshop hosted by NYSEC and guided by Russell G. Jones

For more information, contact Leader Anne Klaeysen at [masked]

What will it take to make the NY Society a more multi-racial community? Here’s a way we can start. The Blind Spot is committed to making the language and critical thinking skills around privilege, race and oppression more commonplace. Participants engage in workshops using multiple media with the purpose of helping them act accountable for these issues. It isn’t about shining a harsh light on guilt, privilege or inequities; it uses positive content and ideas to illustrate the debates and discussions that are constantly happening around us. The goal is to grow in our understanding of these issues both intellectually and emotionally.

Video Prompts-  http://russellgjones.com/video-prompts-nysec/

Take Action- http://russellgjones.com/take-action-nysec/

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Please join the Coalition to Ban Horse-Drawn Carriages and concerned activists to protest the inhumane, cruel and abusive horse-drawn carriage trade.

Stand with us as we educate tourists and others not to take these rides.

Supporting the carriage trade is supporting  institutionalized cruelty. It is legal now, but its days are numbered.

Please speak out for the exploited carriage enslaved carriage horses.


We cannot do this without you.

WHEN: Sunday December 20th - 1:00 pm to 3:00 pm

WHERE: 59th St. & 5th Avenue, north side of Central Park South west of Fifth Avenue in Grand Army Plaza across from Central Park & diagonal to the Plaza Hotel.

Meet at the north side of Central Park South off Fifth Avenue.  We will supply posters and flyers but you are welcome to bring your own posters.

Please "Like" us Facebook - No Walk in the Park

</a>

Follow us on <a href="https://twitter.com/BanHDCarriages">Twitter and sign our petition in support of legislation to ban horse-drawn carriages in NYC.


www.banhdc.org

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

Update as of[masked]:

"Tis' the Season Shoot w/Ingrid, Dayderis & Maggy - Dec. 20th"

Welcome to all new members! We are happy to present to you the last Meetup for 2015. We are truly thankful to all of our amazing members and spectacular models we have had the pleasure to work with and look forward to what 2016 brings. We have a great shoot planned with non other than member favorite Ingrid Araly, who always leaves us waiting for her next visit! We also have two new models to our group, Dayderis who is a NJ local and such a pleasure to work with and we're sure she'll become a member favorite also. Maggy is also new to the group and brings such a fun attitude and always has a smile for the camera. She is the definition of a blonde bombshell!

About the Shoot:

"Tis' the Season" for a winter fashion, sexy lingerie and Christmas pinup shoot! We wanted to roll up the upcoming winter season with the Christmas holidays and of course lingerie. (We are a glamour group by the way. lol) The first look will be a fashion look. Weather permitting, we'll shoot outdoors with a more winter fashion style with a sexy twist. Our second look will be lingerie. (We will have a bed setup, a casual couch setup and a facade brick wall setup.) Our last look will be a Christmas inspired pinup look. (Everything from lingerie, swimwear or christmas outfits may be worn by the models.)

RSVP:

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup so you know what to expect at the shoot. 

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page.

Total Cost: $100

Deposit: $40 (Paypal) (Don't mark the checkbox as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

(Keeping the deposit at increments of $20 so it's easier to pay on the day of the shoot.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.

Models: 

Ingrid Araly: MM#[masked] 

(Photo Credit: NandoPro)

Dayderis: (Courtesy of Jeff Black Models)

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

Maggy:

(Photo Credit: NandoPro)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Tis' the Season Shoot w/Ingrid, Dayderis & Maggy - Dec. 20th

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
